title: Early Career Program Project Manager & Change Lead
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Our Excellerate Global Leadership Program will give you an outstanding opportunity to engage with commercial projects at a strategic and global level, rising up to challenges and becoming and developing as a leader.
   

  

 As part of the Excellerate program you are able to seize the initiative, operate with a consultative approach and collaborate on cross-technology solutions. The program will ensure you gain real practical insight into our business, our stakeholders and our customers including communication service providers (CSP) across the globe, and how we integrate end-to-end solutions to ensure everyone worldwide is connected.
   

  

 Journey within the Excellerate Program will start as a Project Manager & Change Lead at Group Supply!
   

  

**What you will do:**
 Our Supply organization is responsible for the entire global supply chain in Ericsson, including supply chain design and orchestration of our production and logistics network, demand and supply planning, customer order fulfillment and supplier management. We are going through a supply chain transformation using digital technologies as enablers to make major breakthroughs to boost customer centricity, cash efficiency and improved productivity and resilience.
   

  

 Our Excellerate Global Leadership Program gives you an outstanding opportunity to shape the future of our supply chain. You will be working with the end-to-end value chain as well as making deep dives in selected areas, facing exciting challenges to make you develop in becoming a leader! In addition, you will have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Perform high quality analysis and present insights, conclusions and recommendations
* Challenge status quo based on facts and logical reasoning and provide fresh new ideas
* Ensure that the project, assignment or use case delivers a result unlocking value and delivering business impact
* Be a motivator for change and improvement by engaging with people in different parts of the organization


**The skills you bring:**
 Your personal qualities are important for us, and we believe you are curious, innovative and collaborative. You have a motivation and interest in working in the Supply area, ideally with some relevant experience in supply and change management.
   

  

**In addition, we believe you have:**
* BSc or MSc in Industrial Engineering & Management, Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent
* A global attitude and willingness to relocate internationally
* Interest in experimentation and innovation with the ability to think creatively and be well adapted to change
* Passion about bringing your ideas to the table
* Keen interest to learn and to broaden experience
* Ability to collaborate, engage with and mobilize the organization to secure results
* Ability to dig into the details when needed to resolve critical issues
* Solid communication skills and proficiency in English.


 We can promise you a steep learning curve, exciting tasks and close collaboration as a valued member of a strategically important team at Ericsson’s largest Business Area. Be the one who did. Find out more about our Early Career program, what the alumni's are up to now and how the program can transform your career at www.ericsson.com/ecp
   

  

 The selection and interview process is ongoing, so send your application in English. If you have specific questions you are welcome to email recruiter Srishti Tandon srishti.tandon@ericsson.com
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 The selection and interview process is ongoing, so send your application in English as soon as it is ready. Kindly note that we cannot process applications sent via email.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 755874
   

  

 Last day to apply : 21st Nov 2024
   

  

 ]]>

title: Engineering manager, Digital Transformation
description:
At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



 To learn more about what we make possible,
 **meet some of our customers** 
 or
 **take a look at some of our products** 
 .
 



  





**Drive our Digital Future** 




 As the Digital Transformation Engineering Manager, you will be at the forefront of our organization’s digital evolution. You will lead the development and integration of cutting-edge IT systems that will revolutionize our operations, enhance efficiency, and create new opportunities for growth. Your expertise will be instrumental in building scalable, intelligent systems that will power our digital journey and redefine how we work.
 



  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 



* Leading Digital Transformation: Spearhead the development and implementation of digital solutions that align with our business strategy.
* Building High-Performance Teams: Assemble and lead a team of talented software engineers to deliver innovative digital solutions.
* Systems Architecture & Design: Design and architect robust, scalable IT systems that support our digital transformation initiatives.
* Agile Delivery: Drive agile development methodologies to ensure rapid delivery of digital solutions.



  





**We are seeking a candidate with:** 



* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 7+ years of hands-on software development experience and at least 3 years of leadership experience.
* Proven experience in designing and building scalable IT systems.
* Strong project management and organizational skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experience with Salesforce and/or D365FO is a plus.
* A proven track record of delivering successful digital transformation projects.
* Strong understanding of emerging digital technologies and trends.
* A passion for innovation and a desire to challenge the status quo.



  





**We value:** 



* Experience with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
* Proficiency in Azure cloud platforms and services.
* A passion for building high-performing teams.
* A strategic mindset and the ability to see the big picture.
* A strong customer focus and a commitment to delivering exceptional user experiences.



  





**Next step:** 




 Please address your questions to Mikaela Nilsson (mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com) and submit your resume (only in English) or LinkedIn profile through our website. We're looking forward to your application!
 



  





**Where we stand:** 




 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
 



  





 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
 



  





 Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Skolvaktmästare Hammarbyskolan södra
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Hammarbyskolan södra är en f-9 skola som ligger i södra Stockholm. Skolan har idag 850 elever i förskoleklass och grundskola. I organisationen finns även en stor fritidshemsverksamhet med flera avdelningar och en fritidsklubb. Skolans lokaler är totalt 13 000 kvadratmeter samt 200 kvadratmeter i Enskede gård.
   

  

 Hammarbyskolan södra är en skola för elever med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Personal och skolledning har höga och positiva förväntningar på våra elever. Trygghet, trivsel och god hälsa är avgörande för att våra elever ska nå goda resultat i skolan. I vårt gemensamma elevhälsoarbete har vi fokus på förebyggande och hälsofrämjande arbete.
   

  

 Organisationen har tillagningskök med två kockar och ett eget skolbageri, vilket innebär att vi får mat lagad från grunden varje dag. Detta bidrar till elevernas möjlighet till lärande under hela skoldagen.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om skolan på skolans hemsida grundskola.stockholm.se/hammarbyskolansodra
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Du kommer i rollen som skolvaktmästare bland annat åtgärda fel och brister i skolans lokaler och skolgård samt ansvara för systematisk skötsel, underhåll och besiktning av skolans fastigheter. Du kommer att i samarbete med skolledning ansvara för det systematiska brandskyddsarbetet samt skyddsronder. Vaktmästare är kontaktperson för både interna och externa samarbetspartners, exempelvis hyresvärd och städbolag. Du ansvarar även för att organisera ommöbleringar och omflyttningar samt inventering av möbler, utrustning och annat. Du ansvarar för beställning av diverse material samt varumottagning och varutransporter. Du kommer vidare också att ansvara för nycklar, larm sophämtning, källarutrymmen och annat som hör vaktmästeriets ansvarsområden till.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har gymnasial utbildning och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet för aktuell tjänst. Tidigare erfarenhet av arbete som skolvaktmästare är meriterande. Arbetet ställer krav på både teknisk och IT-kompetens som bland annat innebär grundläggande kunskaper i Office-paketet.
   

  

 Du kan arbeta självständigt och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter. Du har även god samarbetsförmåga och kan skapa goda relationer då arbetet innebär många kontaktytor med elever, personal, interna och externa samarbetspartners. Då arbetet är ojämnt fördelat över året krävs god förmåga att kunna prioritera och organisera arbetet.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personliga egenskaper, i synnerhet avseende förmåga att möta elever.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 I Stockholms stad finns drygt 140 grundskolor och 30 gymnasieskolor med olika inriktningar.
   

  

 Före anställning krävs uppvisande av belastningsregisterutdrag för arbete i skola. Provanställning kan komma att användas vid prövobehov.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Johanneshov | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/5745 | Kontakt: Pelle Kyhlén 08-50846814, | Publicerat: 2024-11-07 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-21

title: Customer Experience Manager / Project Manager - Part time
description:
*One of Sweden's leading telecom company is looking for a 
 **Customer Experience Manager / Project Manager** 
  for a consultant assignment. The client's vision is to find smart and unrestricted solutions together with engaged contributors who are ready to join the mission for a society without limitations.* 




**Duration:** 
  2024-11-06 to 2025-01-31, with a possibility of extension.
 **Where:** 
 The position is based in Kista, with an expectation to work on-site.
   





 The position is a part-time consultant contract of 20 hours per week.
   




 About the role
 
 Your mission will be to represent the customer’s voice within Entertainment and our client’s B2C regarding the customer experience of their TV & Streaming products, with the goal of maximizing customer satisfaction and NPS.
 


**What you'll do** 
* Gathering, analyzing, and compiling feedback from customers, major customer surveys, and NPS tracking, ensuring relevance to the strategy and business goals
* Initiating and driving investigations and analyses to enhance customer experience and streamline processes
* Leading IT and communication initiatives aimed at harmonizing and optimizing the customer experience, often spanning multiple brands, channels, and products
* Mapping the customer journey for Entertainment, collaborating closely with other process and CX owners within our client, and working in close partnership with the rest of the Entertainment team


 Who you are
 * Experience in managing customer experience and customer journeys for digital products in a large organization
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively in a cross-functional environment
* Proficiency in both spoken and written Swedish and English


 We are Market Partner
 
*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.*

title: Servicesamordnare till Sorma!
description:
Är du tekniskt intresserad, lösningsorienterad och redo att ta ansvar i en ledarroll? Hos Sorma, en ledande leverantör av städmaskiner med starkt fokus på miljö och hållbarhet, blir du som
   

**Servicesamordnare**
 en nyckelspelare i att säkerställa smidig drift. Du kommer fördela jobb till tekniker, hantera reservdelar och planera utbildningar – allt för att säkerställa bästa service. Om du vill arbeta med marknadsledande teknik och göra skillnad, är detta rollen för dig! Sök idag - Urval sker löpande!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Sorma Sverige AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Grönt jobb
   




**Om tjänsten**

 I din roll som Servicesamordnare hos Sorma kommer du att tillhöra ett team med 6 tekniker som är utspridda i Stockholm, Norrköping och Norberg. Din placering kommer att vara i Solna. Du kommer att ansvara för att koordinera och optimera serviceleveranser genom teknisk samordning, administration och kundsupport. Du kommer att sitta med serviceplanering och övervaka att servicar utförs inom de tidsramar som är uppsatta och följa upp att dom gjorts och är korrekta innan vidare behandling. Du kommer att ha den primära kundkontakten och svara på telefonsamtal och e-post från kunder rörande service- och garantiärenden för att säkerställa att ärendena hanteras professionellt och effektivt. Du ansvarar även för kontrollen av serviceordrar för att säkerställa att de är korrekta innan fakturering till kund. Rollen kräver både teknisk kompetens och utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter för att säkerställa hög kundnöjdhet och effektiv service.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**

 Övriga arbetsuppgifter som kommer att ingå:
 


  

  
* **Reservdelslogistik:**
 Hantera reservdelsbeställningar samt påfyllnad av reservdelar i serviceteknikernas bilar för att säkerställa att teknikerna har de nödvändiga delarna för sitt arbete.
  
* **Felanmälan:**
 Registrera felanmälningar i arbetsboken som inkommer via e-post och telefon. Du säkerställer att alla felanmälningar dokumenteras och följs upp på ett strukturerat sätt.
  
* **Arbetsfördelning:**
 Ansvara för att akutjobb i arbetsboken utförs i tid och ha mandat att fördela ut jobben till teknikerna. Du ser till att rätt tekniker är tilldelad rätt jobb baserat på prioritet och kompetens.
  
* **Utbildningsansvar:**
 Planera och strukturera internutbildningar för tekniker. Du fungerar som utbildningsansvarig och säkerställer att teknikerna har rätt kompetens och är uppdaterade med den senaste kunskapen. Du är även stöd till säljarna i bolaget.
  
* **Garantiärenden:**
 Hantera garantiärenden och säkerställa att dessa behandlas i enlighet med gällande riktlinjer och avtal.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har tidigare erfarenhet som tekniker eller servicetekniker där du har arbetat med att besöka olika kunder för att utföra service och support direkt på plats så du har en god förståelse för att möta kundens behov i deras miljö.
  
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av att leda/coacha personal.
  
* Har tidigare erfarenhet från liknande administrativa roller och/eller kundtjänst.
  
* Har goda kunskaper i kundservice och teknisk support.
  
* Har starka kommunikativa färdigheter på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med serviceorderhanteringssystemet Pyramid och andra relevanta IT-verktyg.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser Sorma att du har följande personliga egenskaper:**
 Du är lösningsorienterad med ett starkt fokus på kundnöjdhet och har förmågan att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du är noggrann och trivs i en roll där du får ta ansvar och ta initiativ. Din problemlösningsförmåga är stark, och du hanterar utmaningar proaktivt och strukturerat. Med en hög grad av ansvarskänsla säkerställer du att arbetsuppgifter fullföljs med hög kvalitet, samtidigt som du har ett kundorienterat förhållningssätt och strävar efter att leverera service på en hög nivå. Du har ett starkt engagemang för att ständigt förbättra både ditt team och organisationens processer.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work. Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen.
   




**Sorma Sverige AB**

 Sorma s tartade år 2007 och har sedan dess utvecklats till en ledande leverantör av städmaskiner med starka varumärken. Huvudkontoret finns i Solna men de har också lokalkontor i Norrköping och Norberg, Sorma har idag 16 personer anställda. I deras värld är miljö och hållbarhet mycket viktigt. Sorma är stolta att kunna erbjuda marknadens bredaste sortiment av städmaskiner och marknadsledande miljöteknik.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Sorma Sverige AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sophie Markström eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107551

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**About Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for an Engineering Manager to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As an Engineering Manager, you'll manage two to three self-organizing teams, supporting them in the continuous improvement of how they achieve their goals – both on a team level as well as on an individual basis. You’ll work alongside peers who'll have the same goal as you, which is the continued improvement and efficiency of our engineering department. You'll facilitate growth and learning, this may require you to adopt a very hands-on approach but equally important; is to get out of the way when needed.
   

  

**Your Tasks Will Include, But Not Be Limited To**
* Establish or improve ways of working and new processes.
* Build, lead and grow our engineering teams
* Developing smooth onboarding and training for the members of your teams.
* Supporting the teams in cross-team collaboration and communication.
* Coaching teams and individuals on how to improve impact and delivery across the domain with a focus on stakeholder management and communication.
* Proactively identifying problems and working to resolve them in the fast-paced environment Instabee provides.
* Continue to build on the great culture of dedication, collaboration, and caring for each other, while having fun!


**What We're Looking For**
 In order to be successful in this role, we believe that you have 1-2 years of experience working with leadership, and developing teams in agile and high-paced environments. We are looking for someone eager to take on the next challenge and are seeking opportunities to further develop their leadership skills. You aim to concentrate on collaborating with your teams and advancing as an Engineering Manager over the next few years, with the guidance and support of senior leaders.
   

  

* What motivates you is people's growth, the end goal and to really deliver business value efficiently.
* You might have started your career as a developer yourself, before moving into architectural and/or organizational leadership.
* Worked in a fast-growing company organization with high levels of ambiguity and flat hierarchy structures.
* The ability to provide constructive feedback, problem-solving and analytical skills, not to mention collaboration.


 When we call your references they'll tell us about your ability to motivate those around you intrinsically, communicate effectively and always keep the end goal in sight. They will highlight your capability to look at the big picture while being able to zoom in on the details that will allow you to reach your goals.
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 The chance to be part of something truly amazing and fun. In this role, you'll have a tangible impact on the way that our products are developed and the freedom to try new things and ways of working with your teams. You'll work closely with our other Engineering Managers and Staff Engineers who are all passionate about building and improving our products. We can promise you that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set, and have the opportunity to work with dedicated, smart, and humble people.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
   

  

 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
   

  

 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
   

  

 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Konsulter inom Projektledning
description:
Vi söker nu en Process- och Projektledare
 



  





 Uppdragsperiod 3 februari 2025 - 30 jan 2026
 



 Vi behöver ditt svar senast 14 nov
 



  





 Du kommer att vara projektanställd hos oss under uppdragsperioden.
 



  





 Du som konsult är/har:
 



**En hög generalist-kompetens, och mycket hög utbildning och kompetens inom aktuellt område.** 




**Har deltagit i stora uppdrag inom aktuellt område och genomfört uppdrag med mycket hög kvalitet.** 




**Nivån uppnås normalt tidigast efter 8-10 års erfarenhet inom området.** 




**Viktigt att ha förmågan att ta ett huvudansvar för sitt område samt att leda en stora grupper** 




**Du kommer att genomgå en säkerhetsprövning samt registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprocessen kan ta ca 8 veckor och uppdrag påbörjas därefter.** 




  





**Uppdragsbeskrivning:** 




**-Resursen kommer främst att arbeta med processutveckling.** 




**-Processkartläggning Nuläge, via exempelvis intervjuer och workshops** 




**-Analysarbete av processer (nulägesanalys) och framtagande av önskat Ny-läge för processer** 




**-Utveckling av nya processer** 




**-Processrevidering** 




**-Processetablering** 




**-Delta i uppdrag för att definiera och implementera ramverk för processutveckling** 




**-Planera kommande förändringsarbete inom processarbete** 




**-Förändringsledning kopplat till processimplementation** 




**-Dokumentera metoder och arbetssätt** 




**-Utbildning i processer** 




**-Projekt-/uppdragsledning** 




**-Utveckla, revidera respektive implementera processer** 




**-Processkartläggning och analys för nuläge och önskat nyläge** 




**-Planera förändringsarbete och genomföra förändringsledning kopplad till processer** 




  





  





**Obligatoriska krav:** 




**-bevis på utbildning eller certifikat ska dokumenteras** 




**-Högskoleutbildning som ingenjör eller ekonom** 




**-Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att jobba inom energibranschen.** 




**-Minst 1 års erfarenhet av att jobba på en TSO.** 




**-Minst 4 års erfarenhet av att arbeta på myndighet eller statligt bolag.** 




**-Minst 4 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med projekt/processer inom IT för digitalisering av processerna** 




**-Minst 10 års erfarenhet av process- och verksamhetsutveckling i större organisationer.** 




**-Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att leda och driva processutveckling** 




**-8-10 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som projektledare** 




**-Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att planera, facilitera och genomföra workshops med verksamheten.** 




**-Minst 5 års vana av att samla in information och data från interna och externa intressenter.** 




**-Minst 3 års vana av att arbeta med processmodellering med Astrakan i Sparx EA.** 




**-Minst 1 års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med processer inom identitets- och behörighetshantering (IGA).** 




  





**Personliga egenskaper:** 




**-Flytande svenska samt professionell engelska** 




**-God samarbetsförmåga och initiativförmåga** 




**-Social med en tydlighet i din kommunikation** 




**-Lätt att skapa förtroende** 




**-Fallenhet för administration** 




**-Uppskattar att arbeta med och i grupp**

title: Kvantitativ Analytiker till Rediem Capital
description:
**Om oss**
 Rediem Capital är ett nystartat bolag med fokus på hantering av icke-presterande lån (NPL) med ambitionen att bli en ledande aktör inom vår nisch. I dagsläget är Rediem ett helägt bolag av TF Bank AB, men är i processen av att förvärvas av Alektum. Vår målsättning är att bli en Specialised Debt Restructurer (SDR), vilket innebär att vi på ett effektivt sätt kan förvärva, förvalta och omstrukturera NPL-portföljer. I dagsläget förvaltar vi portföljer inom Europa och organisatoriskt är vi ett litet och dynamiskt team på åtta personer som tillsammans bygger upp verksamheten. Vill du veta mer om oss, besök gärna vår hemsida på https://rediemcapital.com/.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker nu en engagerad kvantitativ analytiker som vill vara med och bidra till vår resa. I denna roll kommer du att ingå i finansfunktionen och rapportera direkt till bolagets CFO, där du spelar en nyckelroll i att analysera och modellera data kopplat till våra NPL-portföljer, samt utveckla insikter som stödjer beslutsfattandet inom företaget. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra experter inom risk, affärsutveckling och inköp av portföljer. En viktig del av arbetet innebär att kravställa mot vårt datalager SOTA (State Of The Art), där vi håller samman data för redovisning, affärsbeslut och riskbedömning.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Kravställa och samarbeta med IT och andra intressenter för att säkerställa att SOTA-datalagret möter verksamhetens behov.
* Analysera och utvärdera data för att identifiera trender och mönster i NPL-portföljerna.
* Utveckla och underhålla prediktiva modeller för återhämtning av fordringar och riskbedömning.
* Presentera analyser och rekommendationer till ledningen för att stödja strategiska beslut.
* Bidra till utvecklingen av processer och rutiner för datainsamling och analys.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Akademisk examen inom finans, matematik, statistik eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av kvantitativ analys och datamodellering, gärna inom finansiella tjänster.
* Starka kunskaper i analysverktyg/programmeringsspråk som Python, R, SQL eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora datamängder och skapa prediktiva modeller.
* God förmåga att kommunicera komplexa analysresultat på ett tydligt sätt.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
* Möjligheten att arbeta i en mindre organisation där du har stor påverkansgrad och kan vara med och forma arbetssätt och processer.
* En roll där dina insatser direkt påverkar vår verksamhets framgång och tillväxt.


**Ansökan**
 Skicka in ditt CV och ett personligt brev till maja.ernemo@rediemcapital.com. Vi ser fram emot att höra hur du kan bidra till vårt team på Rediem Capital. Notera att vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!

title: Implementation Manager
description:
**Job Description**
*With an increasing demand for IT infrastructure, our global company is in a sector with rapid growth, and we are now looking for an Implementation Manager to join our team. If you are eager to work on multiple projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, then we look forward to hearing from you.*
**Your role**
 This role offers you the opportunity to showcase your project management expertise and technical skills. As an Implementation Manager, you will assist and provide technical oversight and guidance through your project management and task tracking activities. Working cross-functionally with other teams, you will coordinate the deployment and installation of equipment and infrastructure within a data center environment. It will be your mission to ensure these deployments are completed on time, on budget and error-free.
   

  

 You will be part of a 4-person Nordic team and support our 10 data centers, but primarily the Swedish sites. We work together on a daily basis and support each other with highs and lows.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 The Implementation Manager’s primary responsibility is project management of customer implementations. This typically includes the installation of racks, electrical distribution, cages, containment systems and data cable infrastructure. You will manage multiple simultaneous projects across several data centers using standard project and construction management best practices. Amongst others these will be your tasks:
   

  

* Effectively manage the execution of all assigned customer implementation projects, in accordance with the contractual agreements and implementation timelines.
* Complete end-to-end planning, coordinate of work and take responsibility for resource allocation, quality specs and timeline.
* Coordinate delivery of multiple installations and keep a complete record of process and results.
* Be responsible for and manage customer’s acceptance after completion.
* Assist with coordination of on-site deliveries.
* Submit vendor access requests and ensure vendor’s access is validates in time to keep work on schedule.


**What You’ll Need**
 To be a good fit for this opportunity you’ll need:
   

  

* +3 years of experience from technical work in a data center or company from a similar industry.
* A college degree, preferably technical with know-how of electricity.
* Advance level knowledge of rack, cage, electrical distribution and data cable infrastructure.
* A record of showcasing great customer service skills.
* A detail oriented approach and strong multi-tasking abilities.
* To be a self-starter, proactive, flexible and able to work within and meet deadlines.
* The ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, mission critical facilities environment.


 Since we are an international company it´s necessary that you have excellent communication skills in Swedish and English, verbally and in writing.
   

  

**About Us**
 Digital Realty brings companies and data together by delivering the full spectrum of data center, colocation and interconnection solutions. PlatformDIGITAL®, the company’s global data center platform, provides customers with a secure data meeting place and a proven Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDx®) solution methodology for powering innovation and efficiently managing Data Gravity challenges. Digital Realty gives its customers access to the connected data communities that matter to them with a global data center footprint of 300+ facilities in 50+ metros across 25+ countries on six continents.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
 Our rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers.
   

  

 Join us and you’ll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of our team, you’ll get to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. We’ll also give you plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with us.
   

  

**Apply now**
 Interested in this role? We’re growing fast, so this is a great time to join us and make your mark on our future. The position is a permanent position with employment at Digital's office in Akalla, Stockholm.
   

  

 In this recruitment we are working together with Grafton, Gi Group Holding. Please note that they will also receive your application. Apply through the link.

title: 1st Line Manager Connected Asset Data - Scania
description:
**Introduction**
***Are you a servant leader with a passion for data-driven innovation? Do you want to be part of building a sustainable future for the transport industry?***
***Join us on our mission to optimize our vehicles’ performance through the power of data and connectivity!***
**What You Will Do**
 On this assignment, you will guide your empowered product teams to deliver outcome and drive change together with our great management team. Your responsibilities will include coaching, nurturing competence development, fostering a strong engineering culture, and promoting collaboration.
   

  

 The group’s mission is to collect logging data from our global test vehicle fleet and make the data easily accessible for the global Traton R&D organisation. In practice, this typically comes down to installing logger-equipment in vehicles, sending logging data over mobile network, processing data in AWS and Snowflake, and making data available to our consumers. The outcome is a data-driven development loop as we test our future vehicles in real operations around the globe.
   

  

 Today the group consists of 13 members organized in two teams. The group is based in Sweden and consists of data engineers, cloud engineers, and hardware logger specialist. The teams work with consumers and test vehicles around the globe.
   

  

 The group is a front-runner in enabling data-driven development and you can become a key contributor in shaping the continuation of this journey by:
   

  

  

* Support, coach and develop your team to deliver value and achieve both collective and individual goals.
* Sympathise with the data consumers and guide your teams in the search for opportunities to make the consumers even more successful in their work.
* Drive continuous improvements to streamline work in meeting customer needs.
* Take part in technical discussions to support the team in building high-quality products.
* Cross-functional work with our consumers and various stakeholders within the global Traton R&D organisation.


**Who You Are**
 You have a leadership-background in agile software development and you strive to improve your way of leading yourself and others. As a leader you communicate expectations and use feedback to drive development of both team and individual. You have a deep understanding of the agile manifesto and what it truly stands for.
   

  

 The role requires that you are a good coach and adapt your leadership to different situations.
   

  

**Relevant** 
**background**
* M.Sc. in a relevant engineering field, or equivalent work experience.
* Strong servant leadership skills, with a focus on empowering the team to achieve expected outcome.
* Experience in leading and driving change.
* Experience in software development, with the ability to engage in technical discussions.
* Proficiency in written and spoken English.


**Scania offers**
 We offer a dynamic, agile, collaborative environment where your knowledge and skills are highly valued. As part of an agile and empowered development team, you will be encouraged to take initiative and dare to try new things. Scania’s culture is characterised by openness, diversity and respect for the individual. The people who work here are our most important asset, so we will invest in you to help you grow with us.
   

  

 As a Scania employee, you are offered several benefits in addition to personal and professional development opportunities. These benefits include a mutual bonus, leasing car, occupational pension and flexible working hours.
   

  

**Further information**
 If you have questions regarding the role, please contact recruiting manager Kristoffer Bång at kristoffer.bång@scania.com or +46 700 827 583
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Welcome with your resume and copies of your degree diploma /certificates . We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, but no later than 17th of November. Screening and interviews will be done continuously.
   

  

 Please note that that only applications registred in the system will be handled and a background check might be conducted for this position
   

  

*Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com*

title: Enterprise Architect/Arkitektchef till SEK
description:
**Svensk Exportkredit i Stockholm söker en visionär och förändringsdriven Enterprise Architect och Arkitektchef**
 Vill du vara drivkraften i att etablera arkitekturella mål och lösningar som driver vår affär och utveckling, och som dessutom främjar svensk export och hållbar global utveckling?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Starkt mandat och stöd för att bygga upp och förverkliga en tydlig, långsiktig arkitekturell vision
* En central och ledande roll inom en dynamisk organisation, där din kompetens värderas högt
* Att arbeta i IT-ledningen och tätt tillsammans med CIO för att påverka och forma våra strategiska mål
* En öppen och utvecklingsorienterad arbetsmiljö med ett tydligt fokus på prestation och förändring


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som Enterprise Architect Och Arkitektchef På SEK Leder Du Vårt Arkitektarbete Och Arkitektteam Med Målet Att Bygga Upp En Strategisk Och Verksamhetdriven Arkitektur. I Rollen Förväntas Du
   

  

* Ansvara för att skapa, kommunicera och implementera arkitekturprocesser som engagerar både teamet och andra avdelningar, med fokus på att bygga upp en robust, skalbar och långsiktig arkitektur
* Driva, leda och coacha arkitektteamet mot en samlad arkitekturell målbild med fokus på att främja samarbete och utveckla teamet
* Säkerställa att arkitektteamet är en aktiv del i verksamhetens transformation, och att arkitekturella frågor får en tydlig röst i strategiska beslut och i den agila processen


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 SEK:s arkitektavdelning, som du tillhör och leder, består av 8 medarbetare som tillsammans ansvarar för arkitektområdet från lösnings- till verksamhetsarkitektur. Gruppen ligger inom vår CIO-organisation, där omkring 120 specialister samarbetar i olika kompetensområden som utveckling, PMO, IT Operations och Säkerhet. I denna roll tillhör du Svensk Exportkredits IT-ledning och rapporterar till CIO.
   

  

 Vårt kontor ligger på Fleminggatan 20 i Stockholm och vi arbetar med ett flexibelt arbetssätt och distansarbete när det passar uppgiften.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig med en bakgrund som arkitekt över hela stacken från lösningsarkitektur till verksamhetsarkitektur. Du har flera års erfarenhet av att leda arkitektur- och förändringsarbete och i strategiska positioner med personal- och budgetansvar. Du är van och trygg i dialog med ledning och styrelse, och som ledare över specialistteam. Du har erfarenhet av och goda kunskaper om agila arbetsmetoder, och behärskar både svenska och engelska som arbetsspråk.
   

  

 Du är en senior och målmedveten ledare, kapabel att fatta beslut och driva frågor på ett strukturerat och engagerat sätt. Din starka kommunikativa förmåga gör att du effektivt bygger relationer inom organisationen, samtidigt som du utgör en trygg, pålitlig och transformativ ledare för teamet. Din erfarenhet och förståelse för att bygga en affärsstödjande arkitektur gör dig till en självklar drivkraft i vår utvecklingsresa.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: LMS Specialist within eHealth (Parental leave cover)
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position and team**
 You will be part of Cambio's Learning & Development team. The team is on a journey of change with a lot of development ahead!
   

  

 As an LMS Specialist, you are responsible for optimizing the system to maximize its utility for users and clients. Your strength lies in understanding the system’s capabilities and intended use. With this knowledge, you participate in the entire process from identifying customer or business needs, through development and configuration, to ultimately supporting the system’s end users.
   

  

 In your role, you manage and customize multiple course libraries to meet client needs, create and update courses for client release, handle user accounts, and set permissions. Together with our supplier, you develop and quality-assure solutions and participate in development and configuration to ensure a good user experience. You review improvement opportunities, identify, and resolve more technically complex incidents and support issues for our clients.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for someone who is communicative, organized, self-motivated, unpretentious, and enjoys taking initiative and developing solutions to problems. The work is characterized by a high level of service orientation, the ability to prioritize, and at times, a fast pace. You need to be someone with system proficiency and the ability to handle complex information.
   

  

**To be suitable for this role, we see that you are:**
* Structured and detail-oriented.
* Service-minded and methodical, with an appreciation for creating order and organization.
* Independent and able to identify where your efforts are needed, while also being a good team player.
* Flexible without compromising on the quality of your work.
* Approach tasks with interest, curiosity, and good judgment, while being able to handle a variety of tasks simultaneously.


**Requirements** 
  

  

* Current experience with similar tasks.
* Understanding of LMS/learning platforms and their functions.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English, both written and oral.
* Good knowledge of Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.


**It's a bonus if you**
* Experience working with various LMS and/or learning platforms.
* Knowledge of educational methods and how to best support learning through technical tools.
* Higher education in system management, computer science, IT, archival science, or information science, or equivalent work experience


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm or Linköping
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 1 year fixed-term employment (parental leave cover)
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in Sweden
 **.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Early Career Program Commercial Contract Manager
Erfaren IT-expert? Ta chansen och bli en del av Saab!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du vara med och påverka i det större sammanhanget? På Saab bidrar du till hållbarhet som håller människa och samhälle säkert. Tillsammans kan vi påverka – Din del är viktig*
**Din roll**
 Som IT-expert kommer du att ingå i ett team som ansvarar för att övervaka IT-drift, installationer och underhåll av våra komplexa utvecklings- och produktionsmiljöer. Din expertis kommer bidra till att forma en smidig verksamhet genom att säkerställa nätverkseffektvitet, systemsäkerhet och optimal prestanda.
   

  

 Här kommer du tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor att utgöra ryggraden i vår IT-infrastruktur och arbeta i en innovativ miljö. Tillsammans arbetar ni mot uppdraget att hålla människor och samhällen säkra.
   

  

 På Saab erbjuder vi flera spännande roller inom IT området på flera av våra orter i Sverige.
   

  

 Några av de positioner där vi söker din expertis inom:
   

  

* Systemadministratörer
* Applikationsspecialister
* DevOps/DevSecOps
* IT-Arkitekter
* Specialist inom IT-säkerhet
* Dataingenjörer (BI or AI)


**Din profil**
 För att trivas på Saab tror du på en kultur av nyfikenhet, tillit och samarbete. Det spelar ingen roll om du är i början av din karriär eller är expert inom ditt område, det viktigaste är att du delar vår passion för IT och ny spännande teknik!
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har några års relevant erfarenhet eller utbildning inom IT och har ett intresse för att ständigt lära dig och utvecklas inom IT området.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsskyddsplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Det du blir del av**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

title: Senior Operational Excellence Manager - Stockholm
company_industry: Manufacturing, Dairy Product Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Manufacturing
description:
Location
   

  

 Solna, SE
   

  

 At Arla, we are dedicated to achieving world-class standards in operational excellence, and we are now seeking a Senior Operational Excellence Manager in Sweden to join our central operational excellence and digital team, driving and leading the regional Arla Performance System (APS) strategy and implementation across the sites in our Swedish market and playing a key role in moving our production towards our vision of ZERO losses, ONE team and 100% engagement.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 As our new Senior Operational Excellence Manager, you will be part of the Market VP Leadership Team based at our Stockholm Head Office. You will take a leading role in our operational excellence implementation and shaping a culture of continuous improvement across your market. A key focus, apart from leading the OpEx journey in the market, will be to own and lead globally the development and governance of specific APS methodologies and work practices and acting as the subject matter expert within that area.
   

  

 Through regular site visits you will provide hands-on coaching at all levels, assess progress, support site management teams, and ensure that Operational Excellence initiatives are successfully implemented and sustained across sites. As part of the implementation strategy you will ensure successful management of pilot implementation and supporting sufficient capability building strategies for sites to sustain their own initiatives as well as successful expansion of APS to further sites as defined in well developed roll out plans. You will also take a leading role in initiating and fostering strong operational excellence communities within and across key production markets. In addition, you will spearhead efforts to digitalize and automate processes where possible and foster a collaborative environment across cross-functional teams to achieve a zero-loss culture.
   

  

 As part of the Market VP Production area where you hold the operational excellence responsibilities we have defined a Lighthouse site and structured roll out approach to all sites. As such, you will be ensuring the implementation of world class operational excellence practices and standards first at the defined lighthouse site. Following that, and as part of the structure roll out of these practices you will ensure the right design, support structure and speed of expansion of APS and digital transformation roll out from the Lighthouse to the next waves of sites, ensuring the right adherance and consistency of standards aligned to the global model and programmes. For this framework to be successful you will ensure and foster close collaboration with all Lighthouse sites across the other Market regions as well as fostering the “in market” communities to accelerate best practice sharing, capability development and expansion of the various programmes and initiatives within operational excellence.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Be To**
* Drive and lead the implementation of APS, leveraging TPM and Lean methodologies to optimize performance across multiple site regions including Lighthouses and expansion to other sites.
* Function as a key sparring partner in driving the operational excellence and balanced scorecard (SQCDMP) progress and results in the market.
* Use regular site visits to drive the OpEx agenda and APS program forward and partner with Senior OpEx Managers across regions to build APS and digital communities.
* Develop and implement world-class operational excellence ways of working and drive the standardization of processes across multiple production sites fostering communities and collaboration across Lighthouse sites and within regions.
* Facilitate workshops, training sessions and on-the-job coaching in developing capability at all levels to sustain a site and market operational excellence programme. implementation across sites in the market.


**What Will Make You Successful**
 To thrive in this role, you should have a degree in engineering, dairy science, economics, or supply chain management, and at least 10 years of relevant experience in manufacturing, leadership and operational excellence. You have a deep understanding of Lean, TPM, and Continuous Improvement methodologies, and a proven track record of leading large-scale improvement initiatives in a complex, matrixed organization.
   

  

**Further, to successfully deliver on key priorities we believe that you have**
* Strong interpersonal and coaching skills, with the ability to engage and inspire stakeholders at all levels.
* Proven track record of driving large-scale improvement initiatives and achieving measurable results.
* Ability to lead in different situations balancing operational, performance and strategic needs and people development.
* Experience in digital transformation, including automation and Industry 4.0 technologies is highly valued.
* Experience
* A passion for inspiring and developing manufacturing teams towards world-class operational excellence


**What We Offer**
 At Arla, you will be part of a forward-thinking organization that is committed to pushing the boundaries of operational excellence. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact by leading critical improvement initiatives across multiple sites and shaping our long-term operational strategy.
   

  

 We’re committed to professional development and have a positive and collaborative culture. You will work alongside passionate and skilled colleagues who are dedicated to delivering high-quality products and driving continuous improvement across all aspects of our operations.
   

  

**Would you like to join us?**
 If you are ready to take the next step in your career and drive operational excellence at Arla, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your application, including your CV and cover letter, by 07/12/2024.
   

  

**We have a purpose for Good**
 At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?
   

  

**BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD**
 It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Learn more via this link.

title: Solutions Architect Enterprise, AWS Sweden
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Sweden and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
   

  

 Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.
   

  

 They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
   

  

 Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploy production workloads on AWS. Provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

**About The Team**
 About the team
   

  

 The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will have the support to grow your expertise. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments. At AWS you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
* Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
* English business level communication skills written and verbal


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Senior Infrastructure Cloud Architect, Professional Services
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 As a Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect, you will contribute with presales and led complex projects as a Delivery Technical Leader, often involving multiple Amazon and customer teams. You will lead and enable them by applying Amazon Day 1 culture and developing technical expertise to deliver solutions tailored to their business needs.
   

  

 You will work with customers and partners supporting them through planning, prioritization and delivery of complex transformation initiatives, while collaborating with relevant Sales and Service Teams. You will help create and apply frameworks, methods, best practices and artifacts that deliver prescriptive guidance to customers, and publish and present them in large forums and across various media platforms. You will provide guidance regarding customers' technical architecture and investments, maximizing alignment with the AWS platform, and ease of adoption as new services and products become available. You will work towards customer business outcomes, ensuring there is a strong connection between delivery activities and business objectives.
   

  

 Do you have experience leading and delivering large IT solutions in agile environment - plan, organize, and manage all phases of a project lifecycle to ensure successful delivery on a scale?
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 Basic Qualifications
   

  

* Multiple years of IT implementation experience in customer-facing roles
* Track record as technical leader driving engagements and guiding customer investment decisions
* Experience driving discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
* Experience driving presales with senior customer stakeholders in collaboration with internal teams
* Hands-on programming/scripting experience to drive the design, development and deployment of business software infrastructure at scale


**Preferred Qualifications**
* BS level technical degree with Computer Science or Math background
* Proven track record of implementing AWS services in large scale cloud migrations and highly available and fault-tolerant enterprise software deployments
* Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (e.g., security, privacy, SOX, ISO, HIPAA etc.)
* AWS Certifications, e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
