title: Integrationsutvecklare
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. Som integrationsutvecklare erbjuds du ett av Sveriges viktigaste IT jobb, i vilket du varje dag kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.
   

  

 Vi är i dag cirka 500 personer inom IT och vi kommer att växa ytterligare de kommande åren. Detta för att kunna skapa förutsättningar för Sverige att kunna fördubbla sin elproduktion och nå klimatmålen genom att helt ställa om till fossilfri energi. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda oss av den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt öka utvecklingstakten kring system, digitalisering och processer.
   

  

 Vill du jobba och utvecklas i en växande organisation och tillsammans med underbara medarbetare skapa en framåtlutad och robust IT-organisation, sök dig till oss!
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som Integrationsutvecklare kommer du tillsammans med dina kollegor ansvara för och vara med att driva utvecklingen av nästa generations integrationsplattform. Plattformen är samhällskritisk och hanterar integrationer mellan Svenska kraftnäts IT-system och externa aktörer.
   

  

 Du får arbeta i en modern miljö och göra ett verkligt avtryck i den tekniska förflyttningen mot framtiden. Din insats säkrar Sveriges elförsörjning.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla och designa integrationsflöden mellan interna och externa system med API:er och meddelandetjänster
* Hantera, transformera och konvertera olika meddelandeformat exempelvis XML, JSON och liknande
* Dokumentera tekniska design- och systemlösningar
* Deltagande i projekt- och förvaltningsarbete samt stötta projektdeltagare och andra intressenter med kunskap om bästa metod inom området


 Du blir en del av enheten Integration (med ett Integrationskompetenscenter) bestående av 26 engagerade, erfarna och hjälpsamma kollegor.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som arbetar målmedvetet för att nå resultat, alltid med fokus på att leverera hög kvalitet och ett gott resultat. Du är samarbetsorienterad och har ett prestigelöst arbetssätt där du anpassar dig för att hitta lösningar som gynnar hela teamet. Din starka analytiska förmåga hjälper dig att se helheten och samband i komplex information. Du har förmågan till att hålla ett övergripande perspektiv och ser hur systemlandskapet utgör en del av en större helhet. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Skallkrav
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du har utbildning från högskola eller universitet inom datasystemvetenskap, systemutveckling eller liknande, alternativt motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt.
   

  

 Du har även
   

  

* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av integrationsutveckling på en integrationsplattform som t.ex. Oracle SOA, Mulesoft eller Biztalk.
* Erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling som bygger på mikrotjänstarkitektur och container-teknik, t.ex. Docker/Kubernetes.
* Erfarenhet av XML, XSD och XSLT för XML-transformation.
* Erfarenhet av Java-utveckling.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och i skrift.


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av
   

  

* Java-ramverket Apache Camel.
* Ramverken Spring/Spring Boot.
* Meddelandeutbyten baserat på exempelvis JMS, AMQP, Kafka, SFTP, SOAP och REST. Testramverk t.ex. JUnit eller Citrus.
* Bygg- och release-pipelines i CI/CD-plattformar som t.ex. Azure DevOps server eller GitLab.
* Helm och ArgoCD för paketering och distribution av applikationer.


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-11-21.Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid


 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Svenska kraftnät med IDG Recruitment. För frågor kring tjänsten och rekryteringsprocessen, välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Alexandra Tihinen, telefon 070-447 92 24, alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com.
   

  

 Rekryterande chef är Magnus Kjellme. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Failure Investigation Analyst (temp)
description:
***This job is with Danaher, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
 Cepheid is a leading molecular diagnostics company that is dedicated to improving healthcare by developing, manufacturing, and marketing accurate yet easy-to-use molecular systems and tests. In our facilities in Solna / Sundbyberg we develop and manufacture diagnostics tests that improve patient outcome all over the world.
   

  

 The Failure Investigation team belongs to the department of Technical Operations and consists of 35 people. The team is responsible for investigation of quality issues in manufacturing and solving problems related to product performance. The Failure Investigation Analyst is supporting ongoing production with laboratory testing to understand failure modes and drive to root. The person taking this role will work in accordance with cGMP standards for documentation, data compilation and batch record review to justify product release. Daily responsibilities include planning of laboratory testing, execution of experiments and result reporting to other team members. FI Analyst can also support other departments and participate in Test method validations (TMV) or other validation activities. Root cause analysis and solving problems is the heart of our area and if you are interested in working in a highly dynamic and fast pace environment where work tasks and focus is changing from day to day this is the place for you!
   

  

 We are currently looking for a Failure Investigation Analyst who can work day-and evening shifts Monday-Friday.
   

  

**Responsibilities And Tasks**
* Performing of testing for various Cepheid products to help driving root cause analyses for Non-Confirming lots.
* Support customer complaint investigations with testing.
* Perform TMV or other validation testing as needed and summarize the results
* Perform non-routine testing according to experimental plan
* Assist in keeping trending files updated
* Actively contribute to achievements of goals in the department
* Support and assist in various improvement activities


**To succeed in the best possible way in this role we believe that you have:**
* B.S in Life Sciences, BMA or related degree or equivalent combination of education and experience to perform at this level
* Minimum of 1 year's relevant professional experience


**We Also Think It Is Necessary To Have**
* Experience of hands on laboratory activities and documentation of results
* Ability to work independently and cross-functionally to provide effective support
* Ability to successfully handle multiple testing activities simultaneously within short deadlines
* Good organizational and communication skills
* Attitude of flexibility as well as good teamwork
* Service minded attitude and good collaboration skills to support with knowledge and expertise


 Selection of candidates and interviews are ongoing and the position may be filled before application deadline, so please don't hesitate to submit your application so we can get to know you! If you have any questions please contact Katarina Kelava (Katarina.Kelava@cepheid.se).
   

  

 Join our winning team today. Together, we'll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow's science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: Manager, Quality Systems and Regulatory Compliance
description:
***This job is with Danaher, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
 At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world's most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
   

  

 Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we're working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world's biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.
   

  

 The role will be responsible for managing Quality Systems (QS) processes and related deliverables in conjunction with Company objectives and Regulatory requirements.
   

  

 This position is part of the Quality Assurance department and will be located in Solna, Stockholm, Sweden. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will Have The Opportunity To**
* Lead and monitor Cepheid AB site audits and Quality system inspections readiness
* Lead and develop Cepheid Quality System team ensuring Cepheid AB has continuous compliance with the corporate Quality Policies and applicable regulatory requirements
* Lead the Quality System team to ensure compliant and timely deliverables, such as internal audit program, Quality training program for Cepheid AB, CAPAs, Corrections, etc...
* Participate to the definition of annual quality goals and quality plans
* Lead the Quality System Management reviews
* Monitor Quality key performance indicators and coordinate Problem Solving Plan cross-functional teams where needed
* Manage CAPA process and ensure compliant and timely deliverables of corrective and preventive actions.


**The Essential Requirements Of The Job Include**
* University degree in Life Science or related
* At least five years experience in Quality Assurance, preferably in the diagnostics / medical device industry
* Excellent skills in written and verbally (English required)
* Experience of external audits and of working in a global environment
* Experience or capacity to leading projects or teams


**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**
* Qualified Quality System auditor (ISO9001 - ISO13485)
* Knowledge of risk management standard (ISO14971) and tools (FMEA, FTA etc..)
* ISO 13485, 21CFR Part820, MDSAP related regulations


 Cepheid, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it's a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.
   

  

 At Danaher we bring together science, technology and operational capabilities to accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow's science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life. Our global teams are pioneering what's next across Life Sciences, Diagnostics, Biotechnology and beyond. For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: Business Development Manager/Account Manager till ECIT NORIAN AB
description:
Är du en driven och relationsskapande person som vill vara med och hjälpa företag att effektivisera sina affärsprocesser genom digitala lösningar? ECIT NORIAN söker nu en driven medarbetare som vill bli en del av deras team och bidra till att förenkla ekonomiadministration!
 



  

**Företag :**
 ECIT NORIAN AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm, Sundbyberg
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Försäljning
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 ECIT NORIAN fortsätter att växa och söker nu en ambitiös och resultatorienterad Business Development Manager/Account Manager med fokus på nykundsbearbetning.
 


  


 Vi söker dig som verkligen vill utvecklas inom försäljning. Hos ECIT NORIAN är det viktigt att du är en prestigelös lagspelare som samskapar med både kunder och kollegorna på jobbet. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha egenskaper som driv, målfokus och nyfikenhet. Om du har viljan att utvecklas kommer ECIT NORIAN att ge dig kunskaper och förutsättningar att lyckas, ett steg i taget!
 


  


 De är ett team på 10 personer med stark sammanhållning, fyllda av glädje, energi och driv. Hos ECIT NORIAN är det högt i tak – de uppmuntrar öppenhet, ärlighet och att våga säga vad man tycker. De är stolta över sitt arbete och deras gemensamma arbetsplats, och tillsammans skapar de en positiv och inspirerande miljö!
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En spännande och dynamisk arbetsplats med stora möjligheter att påverka och växa
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med innovativa digitala lösningar som hjälper företag att automatisera och effektivisera sin administration
  
* Stöd från ett erfaret och familjärt team med en stark koncern i ryggen
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**

 Som Business Development Manager/Account Manager hos ECIT NORIAN kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i bolagets fortsatta expansion genom att aktivt identifiera och bearbeta nya kunder. Du ansvarar för att presentera outsourcing-lösningar inom redovisning, löneadministration och affärsstöd till företag som vill effektivisera och digitalisera sina ekonomifunktioner.
 


  


 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att vara:
 


  

  
* Driva nykundsbearbetning och skapa nya affärsmöjligheter
  
* Bygga långsiktiga relationer med beslutsfattare inom olika branscher
  
* Presentera och sälja ECIT NORIAN's outsourcing- och digitala lösningar
  
* Arbeta nära andra avdelningar för att säkerställa smidiga övergångar och hög kundnöjdhet
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning, gärna inom ekonomi eller IT-tjänster
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, i både tal och skrift, då det krävs i den dagliga kommunikationen. Eftersom att ECIT NORIAN är en del av en global koncern behöver du även vara bekväm i att tala och skriva på engelska
  
* Är målfokuserad, självgående och har ett starkt driv för att skapa tillväxt och affärer
  
* Har förmåga att bygga förtroende och skapa starka relationer
  
* Är van att arbeta med försäljningsprocesser från första kontakt till avslut
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**ECIT NORIAN AB**

 ECIT NORIAN är ett företag som erbjuder tjänster inom redovisning, löneadministration och affärsstöd, både i form av outsourcing och digitala lösningar. De hjälper företag att hantera ekonomifunktioner som bokföring, skattefrågor, rapportering, löner och lönesystem, och är en del av ECIT Group, ett större norskt IT- och ekonomikonsultföretag. ECIT NORIAN fokuserar på att effektivisera och digitalisera affärsprocesser för sina kunder, ofta genom att använda teknik som automatisering och digitala plattformar för att förenkla administration och reducera manuella processer.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till ECIT NORIAN AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Milly Ellqvist Weidstam eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107589

title: SAP Senior Super User - Battery Production
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 In Battery Production we have installed high volume series production of Battery packs, Modules, two prototype lines for batteries and a line for the series production of VCB cables. We are in a phase where we train and build competence to manufacture Battery packs, Modules and cabling for tomorrow's e-mobility products.
   

  

**SAP Senior EWM Super User**
 The electrification trend within the automotive business is moving rapidly. For us, this means that we need to prepare for ramping up the production of electric vehicles and help Scania to be sustainable. One major component of electrical vehicles is the Battery.
   

  

 Included is building a new factory to produce batteries for electrical vehicles. This new plant will work with fully automated equipment for production and logistics. In this new plant, SAP is being implemented to support logistics, finance and material planning processes. The implementation is ongoing and will be completed within the coming months. We are therefore looking for a new colleague to strengthen our SAP warehousing team within the battery factory.
   

  

 In the role as a SAP super user, you will work with run & maintain of the existing SAP implementation at the battery production unit. This means to support our users in problem solving on daily basis in accordance with our escalation model. You will also work in project and initiatives with mapping of demands of changes, testing, training and implementations. Have a holistic view of our current situation in our IS/IT landscape and coordinate improvements by reporting incidents and change requests. You need to have interest in IS/IT applications, system architecture and competence in SAP.
   

  

 This is a cross-functional role and you represent the business and require therefore that you are service minded and find interest into collaborate with other departments like; logistics, production, manufacturing engineering but also to other production units within the company. In this recruitment We searching for a person with more senior background that can have E2E perspective also understanding and knowledge in MES, SCADA and PLC layer in combination with SAP in our factory.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 Are you driven by the opportunity to be involved and influence? Are you interested in logistics & production? Then this can be the right assignment for you! We are looking for you who have a developing mindset and see every challenge as an opportunity for improvement.
   

  

 In this role, you collaborate cross-functionally with both Production & Logistics but also with our customers. You are the link between operations and the product owner but also responsible for the changes and continuous test that are required. As an important part, you work with a self-motivated group of people who are happy to share experience in the various areas of logistics.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To thrive in the assignment, we believe that you are a person who enjoy taking responsibility, and who dares to challenge. You are communicative and cooperative, see opportunities instead of problems, and are driven to find solutions together with others. We are looking for you with a relevant educational or work experience background, however, earlier experience in SAP EWM - beneficial. You are fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English, and are used to working in Office 365. But the most important thing is that you have the right will, the right drive, and the right interest in developing yourself, together with your colleagues and the business.
   

  

**Your main tasks**
* Identify, plan and lead the SAP improvements within logistics and production
* Inform and train end-users within agreed area (for example PRU, BU, department etc)
* Coordinate within agreed area when there are disruptions
* Give support to end-users concerning how to use the application
* Perform user acceptance (UAT) and other tests within agreed time period
* Change impact analysis, business requirement, proved trainings and take part in Go-live activities.
* Prioritize change requests from business perspective
* Forward support cases and incidents to Scania IT through Service Desk
* Translate deviations and improvements to a functional specifications in JIRA (CRs)
* Run pulse meetings


**More Information**
 Do you want to know more? Please contact Tony Gustavsson, IT Business Manager MELS, tony.gustavsson@scania.com.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application must include a personal letter, CV, and grades. Scania is using tests as a part of the recruitment process. A background check may be done for this position. Selection and interviews will take place on an ongoing basis. Apply via scania.com/career as soon as possible, but not later than 2024-11-15.

title: Senior Data Architect - Tietoevry Tech Services Sweden (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Would you like to join a community where you will work with the latest technology and where you can grow your competence in a systematic manner? Would you also like to have flexibility in your work and working hours? Do you have experience in transformation projects and want to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the place for you!
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry as a Senior Data Architect:**
 In this position there are two main directions that you would utilize:
   

  

* Business to technology: In this direction, you would be working closely with customer business, IT and other stakeholders with your Tietoevry Tech Services colleagues to translate their business goals into IT architecture and finally into technical solutions utilizing cloud native tools and services.
* Technology to business: In this approach, you would bring thoughts and ideas on how our customers can benefit from cloud solutions in the best possible way.


**“Sounds interesting. So, what would be required from me?”**
* We expect you to have previous experience in design/implementation, deployment verification, migration / development application to Azure, GCP or AWS.
* Several years of experience in the traditional IT in addition to cloud.
* You should be enthusiast towards data and cloud architecture, designing and/or being a strong builder and executioner of these architectures including modelling of them.
* Communication with Swedish language is must as you would be working directly also with customer stakeholders who might prefer local language. Also some documentation customers are having might be written in Swedish.


**It is great if you also have:**
* It really helps if you are possessing a history of successful IT consulting and architecture engagements with large-scale customers.
* Event-based / real-time architecture experience with technologies such as Kafka on Confluent.
* Hands-on experience on AI, ML, GenAI is big plus as several customers of ours have started their AI / GenAI journey.
* We provide assistance for our customers with their Data & Analytics and Roadmap development based on their Business goals (capturing As-Is state, To-be architecture and gaps) and building Transition state architecture. Experience in this kind of consulting cases is a big plus.
* Analytics domain experience on technologies such as Snowflake, Synapse, Databricks.
* Several of our customers are working with some kind of agile model like SAFe or Scrum so agile methods should be familiar to you. But if not, we have great learning capabilities also from these areas for you to master.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Mauri Tusa, mauri.tusa@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

*We background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

description:

 D365 F&O, analysis methods, GL, Project Accounting, swedesh, Service Delivery Models,

title: Commercial Account Executive
company_industry: Software Development, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
**Description**
 It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of
 *Inc* 
 . magazine’s Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are inherently simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500, and our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way.
   

  

 We are looking for a Commercial Account Executive in Sweden to join our Commercial Sales Team, reporting to the Director of Regional Sales. In this role, you will cover a list of accounts (less than 5,000 employees) in your defined region, Nordics. This is a net new commercial segmentation, and the sky is the limit! This means driving net new logos, building a robust pipeline of opportunities, developing key partner relationships, and increasing “stickiness” within the existing customer accounts through cross-selling and upselling. You’re the ideal candidate if you have a relentless pursuit of results, are always trying to understand the customers’ “what, why, and how?”, and enjoy the thrill of doing deals and making things happen. You marry the discipline of a planner with the instincts of a shark – you never stop moving and are ready when you smell opportunity.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Create and execute a sound territory plan to include prospects, customers, partners, and marketing
* Close new business with customers within your assigned region
* Develop a strong pipeline of opportunities within your account base
* Accelerate growth and profitability within existing customers by leveraging existing customer and partner relationships
* Effectively leverage internal and external resources to meet territory objectives
* Represent Infoblox and our suite of offerings to customer executives, partners, and at industry marketing events
* Provide accurate visibility in terms of revenue and progress by way of financial forecasts
* Support and accelerate partner contribution
* Maintain sufficient activity levels to achieve sales targets and build the necessary pipeline to drive quarter-over-quarter growth goals


**What you'll bring:**
* 5+ years’ experience of successful SaaS or technology sales with a proven track record of overachieving quotas
* Ability to understand customers’ business and technical problems relative to networking, security, and Cloud enablement and translate those into Infoblox solutions
* Track record of successfully nurturing customer relationships, identifying new opportunities, and increasing lifetime value within existing accounts
* Strong sales and relationship-building skills with a proven track record of efficiently navigating sales cycles and closing new business
* Experience with formal sales methodology (e.g. MEDDPICC), excellent sale hygiene and experience with SFDC and Clari
* Strong problem-solving skills in sales campaigns with an unmatched desire to win
* Ability to present technical concepts and business solutions clearly through engaging and innovative discussions and presentations
* Excellent written, presentation, and social skills and a commitment to absolute integrity
* Fluency in English and Swedish


**What success looks like:**
 After six months, you will…
   

  

* Have onboarded and be entrenched in your accounts executing against your territory plan
* Have built strong relationships with our partner network and internal stakeholders
* Be confident in delivering POC, webinars, and communicating our value proposition


 After a year, you will…
   

  

* Be focused on the expansion of existing customers and the acquisition of new customers
* Have delivered consistent quarterly results of pipeline generation and quota attainment
* Have taken the opportunity to develop your career within Infoblox
* Act as a mentor to new hires in the commercial sales organization


**We’ve got you covered:**
 Our holistic
 **benefits** 
 package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness—as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and generous paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our
 **values** 
 every day—we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers.
   

  

**Why Infoblox?**
 We’ve created a culture that embraces
 **diversity, equity, and inclusion** 
 and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you’re a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out
 **what it’s like to be a Bloxer** 
 . We think you’ll be excited to join our team.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 application expert within finance
description:
*Do you have solid experience within finance implementations and want to take the next step in your professional journey? Do you have an entrepreneurial mindset and want to continue to build the modern Microsoft practice at KPMG Sweden? Then this is the opportunity for you!*
**About us:**
 Technology Transformation part of Management Consulting at KPMG Sweden is in the middle of an exciting journey, where in recent years has grown to establish global alliances and have, among other things, been named Microsoft's Partner of the Year 2020, as well as earning membership in the Microsoft Business Applications 2024/2025 Inner Circle, we continue to be recognized as the top 1% of Microsoft Business Applications partner. This is our 7th consecutive year! As a result, we are now looking to expand our team with a
 **Microsoft Dynamics 365 application expert within finance.**
 Join our dynamic team and be part of building a practice within one of the leading consultancy firms in the world. At KPMG, you will work alongside global networks, leveraging our structural capital and expert competence, while playing a pivotal role in driving growth within KPMG Sweden's Microsoft practice.
   

  

**Your role:**
 As a
 **Microsoft Dynamics 365 finance application expert** 
 , you will assist global clients with ERP transformation projects, from sales to implementation, and help them digitalize and future-proof their operations. You will engage in presale activities and, if interested, participate in marketing efforts and key account work. This position offers the opportunity to collaborate with and learn from top industry professionals.
   

  

 This is an exciting role where you will be able to shape and deliver projects and get the chance to work cross functional with other experts in a global complex and fast-moving environment. You will work closely with our clients in a consultative way and help them streamline their business processes. Together with your project team, you propose solutions to further develop existing functionalities. We, at KPMG, collaborate with C-level meaning you will get the chance to really make a difference and influence client’s decisions.
   

  

 ,
   

  

* 5 + years of experience working with MS Dynamics 365 Finance implementation,
* Good understanding in financial processes,
* An entrepreneurial mindset and strong communication skills,
* Business-oriented mindset, easily understand business needs and can identify new business opportunities,
* Certifications within MS D365 Finance, MB300, MB 310, (preferred)
* A bachelor’s or master’s degree,
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


**What we offer?**
* A key role in an international professional advisory services firm
* An exciting opportunity to work in different types of projects across various industries
* An inspiring and inclusive environment where diversity is one of our core foundations
* Competitive compensation package and a hybrid way of working
* A great opportunity for professional growth


 Your personality is very important for us, we think that you are a person that thrive building relationships and collaborations both internally, with clients and with external partners. You are a true team player, since we believe that good teamwork is the key to long-lasting sustainable successful solutions.
   

  

 Do you want to make a difference with us?
   

  

 We encourage all interested candidates to apply and look forward hearing from you. Please feel free to contact Lasma Indrijaite, Talent Manager lindrijaite@kpmg.com or Amr Cherif, Microsoft Alliance Lead KPMG Sweden amr.cherif@kpmg.se if you have any questions or would like to know more. We accept applications and interview candidates on a rolling basis.

title: Business Finance Performance Leader
description:
**About The Position**
 We are looking for a Business Finance Zone Performance Leader for the Nordics Baltics to make an impact!
   

  

 At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. Great people make Schneider Electric a great company!
   

  

 As the Business Finance Zone Performance Leader you will be in charge of driving the Zone Financial planning and Performance analysis across the 5 NB Clusters while supporting the Business Finance Head and Zone CFO
   

  

 Your main area of responsibilities will be:
   

  

* Drive Zone Financial planning and performance & animate financial business review calendar
* Act as Single Point of Contact (SPOC) towards Business Finance CoE : responsible for managing stakeholders' requests and follow-up towards Business Finance CoCe
* Ensure monthly closing activities are properly performed by the Business Finance CoCe
* Provide consolidated monthly performance analysis to Zone management
* Animate business review process (Monthly, quarterly, yearly, prior, 3Y)
* Drive LT plan and yearly activities (target, prior, …)
* Drive overall performance (Top Line / GM / P&L) : advise and coordinate stakeholders, ensure consistency, monitor / anticipate / challenge gaps Vs Target
* Drive quarterly Forecast : advise and coordinate all stakeholders, ensure overall consistency
* Provide strong support to the Finance leadership team and collaborate with Zone Management team
* Provide ad-hoc analysis for Zone tactical business decision
* Work on specific project (strategic Finance) and provide macro economics / benchmark / mkt share, composite index, baseline effects, assumptions (RMI, ..) to various stakeholders
* Provie daily support to Business Finance Head , CFO and Business Stakeholders on overall tactical and strategic actions and simulations
* Support Business Finance Transformation and One Finance contribution
* Being a change agent by proactively contributing and collaborating to ONE Finance community activities, working towards harmonized, efficient and compliant ways of working, applying latest digital tools, dashboards and policies.
* Be the Subject Matter Expert for selected topics across the Zone and ensure Global standard application within the scope of activities
* Support transformation by identifying and working on standardization, automatization and digitalization of processes and dashboard.
* Collaborate with One Finance functions to deliver best-in-class financial performance and reports (timeliness, quality and meaningful insights)


**Profile we are looking for:**
 As a person, you are open, straightforward and have excellent communication skills. You thrive in complex environments and understand the importance of stakeholder management. You have excellent analytical skills, are hands-on, strong attention to details, organized and highly structured, without losing sight of the big picture and having compliance at the center of your agenda. You are proactive, dynamic, with a commercial mindset, seek to give advice, and dare to challenge. You have lots of energy, drive and possess a “what does it take” mindset. You are a change agent, familiar with simplification projects driving efficiency gains through process improvements and digitization. You are fluent English, speaking Swedish a plus but not a must.
   

  

**Experience and skills we are looking for:**
* Ideal candidate have 5-8 years of experience in finance and performance analysis rôle
* Excellent analytical, verbal, and written communication skills necessary to interact with stakeholder at various levels of the organization
* Proficiency in financial modeling, Excel, and financial management systems
* Team player with a commercial mindset, dynamic, proactive, collaborative, curious and open minded.
* Think outside of the box, challenge, and standardization/automation/simplification mindset


**Location:**
 The role is to be based in Sweden, either at the Swedish Head Quarter in Stockholm or at the innovative Global R&D site in Lund.
   

  

**Why us?**
 At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a
 **meaningful** 
 purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.
   

  

 We believe in
 **e** 
**mpowering** 
 our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.
   

  

 We embrace
 **inclusion** 
 as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.
   

  

 If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Discover your
 **M** 
**eaningful, Inclusive** 
 and
 **Empowered** 
 career at Schneider Electric.
   

  

 €34.2bn global revenue
   

  

 +12% organic growth
   

  

 135 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

*Schneider Electric aspires* 
*to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best.*
*We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we ‘embrace different’ as one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.*
*You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion* 
*here* 
*and our DEI Policy* 
*here*
*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion,* 
*color* 
*, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Sales & Marketing Coordinator
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Vantive: A New Company Built on Our Legacy
   

  

 Since last year, Baxter has been on a journey to separate our Kidney Care segment into a standalone company. Vantive\* will build on our nearly 70-year legacy in acute therapies and home and in-center dialysis to provide best-in-class care to the people we serve. We believe Vantive will not only build our leadership in the kidney care space, it will also offer meaningful work to those who join us.
   

  

 At Vantive, you will become part of a community of people who are focused, courageous and don’t settle for the mediocre. Each of us are driven to help improve patients’ lives worldwide. Join us as we revolutionize kidney care and other vital organ support.
   

  

 \*Completion of the proposed sale of Vantive to funds managed by the Carlyle Group is subject to receipt of customary regulatory approvals and satisfaction of other closing conditions.
   

  

**This is where, you collaborate!**
 Join the future Vantive as a
 **Sales and Marketing Coordinator** 
 to collaborate with our dedicated teams in the UK, Ireland & the Nordics, coordinate events, and drive impactful initiatives. Make an outstanding impact by seamlessly implementing our strategic activities within our organization.
   

  

 This is a hybrid position with two days of remote work per week.
   

**What you'll be doing :** 
* Coordinate local team meetings, customer events, congresses, and exhibitions in cooperation with sales and marketing teams, including running the grant process, invoice process, purchase orders, and budget follow-up.
* Develop and implement new digital patient training tools and external patient training materials.
* Take charge of digital campaigns, maintaining databases and records of marketing materials.
* Participate in developing Digital Service Selling (BCCI, MySource; ShareSource) including the development of an online learning portal.
* Collaborate with the Marketing Manager to develop materials within guidelines and act as a superuser for material approval (in Veeva/Promomats). Coordinate and distribute materials to team members and customers.
* Maintain databases and records such as the monthly highlights and compile reports for team members.
* Provide support to product, marketing, and sales managers/directors.
* Assist in coordinating larger Vantive Nordic activities, including the Nordic conference and other significant events.
* Apply systems like Coupa, Target II, and PEGA to build purchase orders, code invoices, and upload documentation for grants.


**What you'll bring :**
* Bachelor of Business Administration or equivalent with successful experience in working in an administrative role
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both native and English languages.
* Proficiency in MS Office applications and InDesign.
* Accountability combined with a positive "can-do" attitude.
* Confirmed project management skills with the ability to manage your own areas of responsibility and ensure progress in a large international matrix organization.
* Dedication and commitment to delivering outstanding results.
* Enjoyment in handling details when necessary.
* Interest in digital solutions for sales and communication.



  

  


**Reasonable Accommodations**

 Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.
   

  


**Recruitment Fraud Notice**

 Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Vill du arbeta med IT-support på domstol?
description:
Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Har du erfarenhet av IT-support, drivs av att ge bra service och vill göra skillnad varje dag genom att bidra till Sveriges rättssäkerhet? Då kan det här vara jobbet för dig.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta som första linjens support mot domstolens medarbetare. Du ingår i ett team med två andra kollegor där ni tillsammans stödjer verksamheten genom att säkerställa att användarna har välfungerande IT-utrustning och IT-stöd.
   

  

**Du Kommer Att**
* ge tekniksupport till användare främst på Windows 10, Office, och telefoni,
* tillhandahålla datorer, telefoner och EFOS-kort för domstolens användare,
* registrera inkomna frågor och felanmälningar i ärendehanteringssystem,
* svara för behörighets- och kontoadministration i AD och andra system,
* vara kontaktperson mot leverantörer och Domstolsverkets centrala IT-funktioner som också är din andra linje,
* förmedlar information till användare vid exempelvis akuta driftstörningar, planerade avbrott och förändringar och
* delta i mindre projekt och utbilda användare genom att ta fram lathundar och hålla i kurser.


 Du kommer ha titeln IT-handläggare och vara placerad på Service- och säkerhetsenheten. På enheten finns även funktionerna för kontorsservice och ordningsvakter.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Gymnasieutbildning eller annan motsvarande utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Erfarenhet av arbete i IT-support.
* Erfarenhet av arbete i ärendehanteringssystem.
* Goda kunskaper om operativsystem och programvaror, främst Windows och Office-paketet.
* Erfarenhet av vanligt förekommande teknik i kontorsmiljö så som nätverksskrivare, AV-utrustning m.m.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift.


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning och/eller yrkesteknisk utbildning inom IT eller annan motsvarande utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med IT-support på myndighet.
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Active Directory.
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med konto- och behörighetsadministration.


 Du kommer att arbeta i en viktig stödfunktion på domstolen vilket kräver att du har en väl utvecklad känsla för service och ett mycket gott omdöme. Du har lätt för att skapa goda relationer samt förmedlar information tydligt och enkelt. Du arbetar nära dina kollegor och delar aktivt med dig av lärdomar och erfarenheter. För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du är resultatorienterad, har förmåga att växla mellan olika arbetsuppgifter och snabbt kan lära dig nya arbetsuppgifter. Du hjälper till att lösa problem genom att använda dina befintliga kunskaper på ett flexibelt sätt och tar emot och anpassar dig efter feedback.
   

  

 För att bli aktuell för anställning krävs att du motsvarar högt ställda krav gällande omdöme, säkerhetsmedvetande och lämplighet. Det innebär att du står upp för demokratiska värderingar och den statliga värdegrund som styr Sveriges Domstolars verksamhet. Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och kan komma att genomföra tester som en del i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Anställning
   

  

 Tillsvidareanställning, sex månaders provanställning tillämpas.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). Du ska, inom ramen för rekryteringen, genomgå säkerhetsprövning. För att anställning ska vara möjlig krävs en godkänd säkerhetsprövning. Därför krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Läs mer om Förvaltningsrätten i Stockholm: http://www.forvaltningsrattenistockholm.domstol.se/
   

  

 Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare:
   

  

 Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.

title: IT Infrastructure Engineer
description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
   

  

 Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.
   

  

 As an IT Infrastructure Engineer, you will be on the front lines of supporting IT and the business using your knowledge and experiences administering IT infrastructure environments. You will have the ability to take ownership of escalated incidents and requests, as well as be a core team member to various critical IT projects.
   

  

 This position is part of the
 *IT Department* 
 and will be located in
 *Solna, Stockholm - Sweden.* 
 At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**
* Cooperate closely with the local IT Team and the business, providing support on important tasks & projects on a critical manufacturing site.
* Oversee local day-to-day IT operations, ensure reliability and security of systems, and drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency and productivity.
* Respond to incidents and requests including escalated issues by executing through to completion or escalating when appropriate.
* Provide business support, including troubleshooting issues and providing appropriate support to the business stakeholders.
* Perform installation and configuration management of systems and applications.
* Facilitate meetings with vendors and cross-functional participants if needed.


**The essential requirements of the job include:**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or information systems.
* 8+ years of working with IT Infrastructure
* Strong understanding of AWS technologies, Active Directory, IAM, PowerShell, Servers
* Experience managing and maintaining Windows servers in an enterprise environment.
* Strong experience managing enterprise Printer & Scan environments and storage technologies.
* Solid understanding of Networking concepts such as DHCP, DNS, Routing, VLAN
* Solid understanding of database and database management technologies
* Fluent level of Swedish and English, in spoken and written


**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**
* Working in a manufacturing environment or logistics
* Previous experience from working in an international environment


 Cepheid, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.
   

  

 Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: Network Hands and Feet
description:
**Required Skills/Qualifications:** 




  





**Minimum 10+ years hands on experience as deskside/Onsite support/local IT engineer with CCNA Certified.** 




**Strong Experience in providing Hands & feet Support for Network (Data center , Office Buildings & Production shop floor )** 




**Strong knowledge and experience of Router, Access points and Switches** 




**Strong knowledge on hardware, software, and networking concepts** 




**Good knowledge in performing LCM (Life Cycle Management of Network Switches etc. ) , LAN Socket Activation & break Fix .** 




**Strong knowledge on cables and connectors etc. CAT, fiber cables, SFP Modules , Stack cables etc.** 




**Strong Customer service skills** 




**Strong written and verbal communication skills**

**knowledge on different types of Ethernet and fiber Cables. (All type of Equipment Knowledge)**
