title: Cloud Architect
description:
Do you want to help strengthen our application architecture and shape our future tech architecture in the Cloud? We are now looking for a Cloud Architect to join us and take the next step on our digitalization journey toward the Cloud.
  
  

About the job
  
As a Cloud Architect, you will lead architectural work within our engineering domain. You will support, guide, and manage the organization’s architecture design. You will play a central role in shaping strategies and plans, as well as leading operational architectural work. Working closely with our development teams, you will build a deep understanding of our workflows and promote collaboration, contributing to smooth and efficient deliveries. Together with the team, you will ensure that the architecture supports security, availability, scalability, performance, and innovation.
  
  

**You will also work on:**  

Continuously developing and establishing the architecture to support the organization’s roadmap
  
Collaborating with various teams across the organization to understand their needs and develop the architecture to meet them
  
Ensuring that technical decisions and architectural patterns follow best practices and industry standards
  
Staying updated on the latest trends and technologies in cloud development, sharing knowledge with the team and the rest of the organization
  
  

You’ll be part of our Cloud team with four colleagues. Together, you’re responsible for our transformation journey toward the Cloud by designing and implementing scalable, cost-effective, and secure cloud applications.
  
  

Who we are looking for
  
To thrive in the role of Cloud Architect, you enjoy discussing technology and have a knack for bringing others along in change initiatives. You are analytical, solution-oriented, and have strong communication skills, enabling you to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical colleagues. To succeed in this role, you need to be diplomatic, have a big-picture mindset, and navigate the organization toward solutions that move us forward.
  
  

**We would prefer that you have:**  

Proven experience as a Cloud Architect or a similar role
  
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform)
  
Knowledge and understanding of modern technologies, architectural patterns, and cloud-native concepts
  
A solid grasp of integration architecture
  
Cloud development certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect) is a big plus
  
  

To succeed and contribute in this role, you should be skilled at driving change effectively, possess strong self-leadership, and have the ability to understand business needs and how they impact architecture. Experience in Fintech is a plus. You are down-to-earth, inspiring, and committed to meeting deadlines, with the ability to prioritize and deliver high-quality results in your work.
  
  

For this role you don’t have to be fluent in Swedish, but it’s advantageous to understand the basics. Our company language is currently Swedish, but we are actively working toward making this shift possible. If this sounds exciting, we would love to see you apply!
  
  

How to apply
  
We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Avanza. Submit your application by clicking the “Apply Now” button below the ad. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so please submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than November 17, 2024. To be compliant with GDPR, we only accept applications through our careers channel.
  
  

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Erik Wikner, Engineering Manager, at erik.wikner@avanza.se.
  
  

We look forward hearing from you!
  
  

Offers from recruitment agencies/sales advertisers are kindly declined.
  
  

/#LI-DNI
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Avanza är Sveriges ledande internetbank för sparande och placeringar. Vi drivs av att förändra branschen genom att utmana de stora bankerna och försäkringsbolagen på den svenska sparmarknaden. Vi vill vara tjänsten som förenklar och förbättrar spararnas ekonomi, oavsett om man älskar aktier eller bara vill ha ett bra sparande. Vår vision är att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. Därför står våra kunders bästa alltid i fokus, precis som det borde vara. Affärsidén är enkel – mer till dig, mindre till banken. En idé som gett oss Sveriges nöjdaste sparare 14 år i rad.
  
  

Erik Wikner | Kontaktperson
company_description: Med visionen om att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor går vi till jobbet för att skapa billigare, bättre och enklare produkter och tjänster för våra kunder!

title: Digital marknadsförare
description:
**Om tjänsten:**  

  

Vi söker en driven och kreativ person som vill ta sig an rollen som digital marknadsförare hos oss. I den här rollen kommer du att vara en central del av vårt marknadsteam, där du ansvarar för att utveckla och implementera vår digitala marknadsföring. Utöver detta kommer du att ha en bred roll med varierande arbetsuppgifter inom marknadsavdelningen, vilket innebär allt från att skriva content och planera kampanjer till att analysera resultat.

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**

* Sätta upp och optimera den digitala kundkommunikationen för att säkerställa effektiv kunduppföljning och förbättrad kundupplevelse, inklusive uppföljning och analys.
* Uppdatera och underhålla innehåll på vår hemsida och våra digitala kanaler.
* Skapa och publicera engagerande innehåll för våra sociala plattformar (främst LinkedIn).
* Optimera Swegons synlighet i digitala kanaler.
* Assistera i skapandet av marknadsföringsmaterial, såsom presentationsmaterial och trycksaker.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och teknikerna inom digital marknadsföring.

  

**Din profil:**


Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring och har arbetat ett par år i liknande roller. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har;

* Erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring inklusive arbete med Google Analytics, Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads, SEO, CMS-verktyg (meriterande med Optimizely) samt CRM-plattformar (meriterande med Hubspot).
* Goda kunskaper i Adobe Creative Cloud (Photshop, Indesign, Premier Pro)
* Är kreativ men har även ett öga för detaljer
* Är analytisk och kan tolka data för att optimera kampanjer


För att du ska trivas och lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har förmåga att ta egna initiativ, driva flera parallella projekt framåt och leverera på mål. Du är säker i din kommunikativa förmåga och har lätt för att målgruppsanpassa och budskapsformulera information. Du trivs med att ta stort eget ansvar och är självgående, samtidigt som du tycker om samarbete i större och mindre sammahang.


Då vi arbetar i en internationell miljö är det viktigt att du behärskar både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Du känner dig trygg med att kommunicera och producera innehåll på engelska för olika digitala kanaler.


Erfarenhet av att fota/filma, klippa och redigera filmer är meriterande.



**Vi erbjuder**  

På Swegon arbetar vi med att skapa världens bästa inomhusklimat som får människor att trivas och må bra - feel good inside. Vi har högt satta mål i vårt hållbarhetsarbete, i att erbjuda de mest energieffektiva produkterna, främja jämställdhet och att bli co2 neutrala, och har en tydlig transparens i vårt arbete. Vi erbjuder spännande utmaningar i en global miljö med kompetenta kollegor och en kultur präglad av våra värderingar; ”Customer Empathy, Trust och Commitment”, som genomsyrar allt vi gör och är utgångspunkten i de beslut vi fattar och hur vi agerar mot varandra. På Swegon har vi en öppen och flexibel organisationskultur med korta beslutsvägar, gott om utvecklingsmöjligheter och är måna om att du ska kunna kombinera ditt arbete med ditt privatliv. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper, välkomnar sökande med olika typer av bakgrund och eftersträvar mångfald och jämställdhet.

 **Om Swegon Sverige**

  

Swegon Sverige AB marknadsför och säljer produkter och system som skapar ett gott inomhusklimat. Vi finns representerade över hela landet med kontor på 17 platser och ca 165 medarbetare. Swegon Sverige AB ingår i Swegon Group, läs mer om Swegon-koncernen nedan.

**Kontaktinformation**  

Välkommen med din ansökan via www.swegon.se/jobb. Vi tillämpar löpande urval och ser gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast **20****/11**. För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta Christoffer Lindström, Marknadschef, på christoffer.lindstrom@swegon.se.
company_addresses: J A Wettergrens gata 7, Gothenburg , Sweden
company_description: At Swegon we take indoor climate quality very seriously and our ambition is to be one of the leading suppliers of indoor climate to our customers.

title: Partner Development Manager
description:
**Partner Development Manager - Sweden**  

  

**About AvePoint:**



Securing the Future. AvePoint is a global leader in data management and data governance, and over 21,000 customers worldwide rely on our solutions to modernize the digital workplace across Microsoft, Google, Salesforce and other collaboration environments. AvePoint's global channel partner program includes over 3,500 managed service providers, value added resellers and systems integrators, with our solutions available in more than 100 cloud marketplaces. To learn more, visit www.avepoint.com.



At AvePoint, we are committed to investing in our people. Agility, passion and teamwork set us up to do our best work and foster a culture where you are empowered to craft your career, make an impact, and own (y)our future. Unleash the power of you!

  

**Overview**



AvePoint is seeking a Partner Development Manager to recruit, convert, and enable prospective MSP's and VAR partners. In this role, you will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying, building partner relationships, and other elements of the presales cycle leading to transaction and sell through to the partners customer base.



We are looking for creative thinkers who are confident and self-motivated with an entrepreneurial mindset. You take pride in seeing your hard work pay off when you see the final results and are determined to help others succeed.


**Your Responsibilities Will Include:**


* Proactively source new prospects
* Nurture, cross-sell and upsell existing MSP Partners
* Collaborate with cross-functional team members in different territories to execute sales plays and build local relationships to drive results
* Partner Sourced Revenue Target Achievement

  

  

**OK, I'm interested… is this job for me?**



We look for people who value agility, passion and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you.


**Other qualities you'll need to be a fit for this role include:**


* 2-3 years previous partner management experience in the SaaS hemisphere
* BA/BS in Business, Marketing, Communications, or similar relevant field
* Strong communication skills to articulate company vision, product changes, and adapting to new strategies - must be business fluent in Swedish & English
* Ability to execute in an environment where priorities change quickly, demonstrating agility, adaptability, and problem solving skills
* Entrepreneurial mindset and detail oriented

  


**About AvePoint**



AvePoint is proud to employ talent from many different backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We believe that diversity and inclusion drives our success and is at the core of how we hire, communicate, and collaborate to deliver value and excellence. We are committed to fostering an environment where people can bring their whole selves to work and feel a sense of belonging, and we continue to work toward creating a workforce that represents the diversity of our customers and communities.

Any personal data you share with us during the application process will be processed strictly in compliance with applicable data protection laws and our Privacy Notice.

title: Business Analyst for the Automotive sector
description:
**Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.**

**Business & Technology Solutions** **(BTS) is a growing practice in Sweden with the aspiration to be the key trusted advisor accompanying our clients on their transformation journey to a more successful, sustainable, and innovative future, bringing in-depth business and technology as well as transformation expertise. By joining BTS, you will have the opportunity to help shape the set-up, form the culture, and together decide on what is important to focus on initially and long term to create a dynamic, fun, and rewarding workplace.**  

  

**We are looking for experienced** **Business Analysts** **to join our** **Automotive** **team, where you work with some of the leading and most well-known brands within this industry driving their digitalization journey. As a Business Analyst you play a leading role in complex client projects at the intersection of business and digital. To support our customers in their digital transformation, Capgemini is looking for consultants with passion for business and technology serving the Automotive sector.**  

  

**The responsibilities will vary between initiatives, you will:**  

* **Bring experience from working in early stages to prepare and initiate implementation of business opportunities**
* **Identify opportunities with existing and new customers, support with your industry know-how and assessment of market trends in the preparation and execution**
* **Act as the bridge between business and IT**
* **Contribute with domain experience within industrial, commercial (marketing, aftermarket, retail) and finance**
* **Be responsible for understanding business requirements and customer needs and translating these to user-stories**
* **Be part of an Agile Delivery team and act as an extension of Product Owner**
**What you'll bring:**  

* **Experience working in the automotive domain**
* **Experience in Requirements elicitation and analysis**
* **Experience with Process Modelling**
* **Data Capture and data analytics**
* **Detailed understanding of Systems Lifecycles and design**
* **Process and platform experience in one or more of the following – Supply Chain Management, Sourcing and Procurement, Sales & Distribution, Manufacturing processes, Connected Services and ecommerce**
* **Experience of implementing larger transformation programs**
* **Experience with SAP, Microsoft and Salesforce is a plus**
**Soft skills and background:**  

* **You are characterized by your experience/interest in business development and sales, your focus on results, your strategic thinking, your high level of self-motivation and customer orientation.**
* **You are a strong communicator who understands the importance of fostering relationships with business and IT stakeholders, you are comfortable working in a mixed client and Capgemini agile environment – and have a good level of Swedish both spoken and written.**
* **You are fine with independent work but have experience of and thinks collaboration and teamwork is the ground for a good result.**
* **Bachelor's degree in business, management, or a related field.**

  

**Apply now! For more information, please mail to bts\_se\_recruitment@capgemini.com.****Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Produktspecialist med teknisk inriktning till Tre
description:
*Välkommen till Tre, telekomaktören som älskar att utmana och utforska.* *Vi tror på laget före jaget, vi vill ge dig ditt livs bästa ledare, vi älskar olikheter, hatar orättvisor och vi applåderar bra resultat framför långa arbetsveckor. Visst låter det Trevligt?*



Vill du vara med och bygga telekoms bästa kundservice? Teamet Customer Service Development befinner sig i en spännande resa och har idag en ledande roll i att driva utvecklingen av kundupplevelse och digitalisering i framkant. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och bidra till att vi tar nästa steg i vår digitaliseringsresa!


**Lite mer om rollen**  

Som Produktspecialist har du konfigureringsansvaret över våra kundservicesystem Genesys Cloud, Zendesk och Boost.ai. Du är motorn i vårt förändringsarbete och behöver förstå och agera på användar- och kundbehov. Det ligger i ditt ansvar att identifiera och prioritera åtgärder och säkerställa att vi konfigurerar rätt utifrån dessa insikter.



Varför är detta viktigt? Jo, det ligger till grund för våra beslut och actions när det gäller kundupplevelsen. Hur gör du det? Du är den som bygger rapporter kring datadrivna insikter i arbetet rörande kund- och användarflödena. Gör du det här själv? Ja, till stor del men du är ett starkt jag, i ett starkt lag som alltid hjälps åt för att vara vårt bästa. Du kommer att arbeta tvärfunktionellt med team från Customer Service, IT Development och IT Operations. Genom en tydlig och öppen kommunikation med dina stakeholders har du fokus på kontinuerlig dialog och förankring. Som vår tekniska produktspecialist inom contact center-domänen kommer du att säkerställa att våra system alltid är uppdaterade och optimerade.


**Du kan se fram emot att**


* få chansen att vara med och forma framtidens kundservice och digitala lösningar
* jobba i en spännande och varierande roll som har touch points på olika områden
* vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work samt att vi är topprankade hos Karriärföretagen
* tillhöra en arbetsgivare som vill bidra till att kvinnor vill välja och stanna kvar inom teknikbranschen, vi är stolta partners till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar


**Lite mer om dig**  

Vi söker dig som har intresse för tekniska lösningar med kundupplevelsen i fokus. Du gillar nog att vägen framåt inte alltid är spikrak och att du får lösa problem och klurigheter på löpande band. Då dessa är system som alla är beroende av är du både proaktiv och uppvisar en stark vilja att hjälpa dina kollegor när stöttning behövs. Eftersom dina kontaktytor finns i flera olika delar utav organisationen ställer det krav på din goda kommunikativa förmåga för att säkerställa att arbetet bedrivs framåt.



För att lyckas i rollen har du jobbat i en liknande roll och det är en bonus om du har kunskap om SaaS-system och de system vi använder. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av digitalisering inom kundservice och har jobbat med datadrivna- och processorienterade insikter. Det är meriterande om du har kunskap om konfigurering. Vi har medarbetare av många olika nationaliteter och det är därför en självklarhet att du talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat.


**Din ansökan**  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vid frågor kontakta rekryterande chef Sofia Levin.

title: Product Manager Atlassian
description:
**ABOUT SINCH :**  

Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
  
Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
  
  

**DESCRIPTION :**  

The Atlassian Product Manager role is part of Sinch’s global Enterprise IT organization, managing our internal IT services. In this role it is important to be self-going, forward looking, great collaborator and with a can-do attitude to be successful together with us.
  
Key tasks and responsibilities as the Product Manager of Atlassian is to take an E2E custodian responsibility of the platform globally. This entails developing the Product strategy and technology roadmap based on business needs, market technology developments and best practices. Furthermore, the Product Manager is expected to:
  
* Take lead of the Cloud migration project currently being executed including merging of local Atlassian instances of Jira and Confluence.
* Act as a subject matter expert to educate other parts of the organization regarding best practices within the Atlassian product portfolio.
* Drive solution design, architecture, and implementation across Jira SW, Jira SM, and Confluence in alignment with business stakeholder requirements.
* Safeguard quality of the Atlassian product portfolio to ensure changes are introduced and managed properly.
* Budget and license management to ensure efficiency in the delivery of the Atlassian related products and services.
* Engage with external partners to participate in contract renewals, project work and service delivery.


In this role you will have the opportunity to influence and make an impact on the area moving forward. Atlassian is used across the company e.g. in our Engineering teams and internal support functions, hence it is a high visibility role from and IT perspective. You will work together with different teams across the business and a collaborative and listening mindset is important to succeed.
  
  

**REQUIREMENTS :**  

* A university degree combined with at least 10 years of relevant technical experience in Atlassian preferably both in Cloud and DC.
* Professional & concise communication skills.
* Leadership skills, capability to drive and motivate both self and others.
* Ability to drive change in global organizations.
* Planning and prioritization of time and resources.


Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in English.
  
  

**OUR HIRING PROCESS :**  

We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Data and AI Community Manager – Stockholm
description:
Are you driven by the passion for building communities and advancing data and AI literacy across organizations? Do you excel at bringing people together with the shared mission of unlocking the power of data for actionable insights? If you have a knack for creating educational programs and fostering collaboration in a growing tech environment, this role could be the perfect fit for you.
  
As a Data and AI Community Manager within the AI, Analytics & Data Tech Center, you will play a central role in developing and nurturing a vibrant community around data and AI. Your main focus will be designing, implementing, and overseeing training and onboarding programs that cater to both technical and non-technical audiences, all while promoting a culture of continuous learning.
  
You will collaborate with various teams across the organization, from platform teams to data governance and business stakeholders, to create resources that help employees leverage data and AI effectively in their roles. Your efforts will directly contribute to establishing a data-driven culture through educational workshops, internal events, and knowledge-sharing platforms.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Training and Program Development
  
– Partner with cross-functional teams, including platform, data governance, and business teams, to develop and maintain onboarding materials for the organization’s data and AI tools.
  
– Design and deliver training programs that onboard our data analytics community to cutting-edge platforms and ensure ongoing updates to meet emerging needs.
  
– Lead decision-making forums with relevant stakeholders to establish standard operating procedures and effectively communicate these to the community.
  
– Spearhead initiatives aimed at cultivating a data-driven organization, including creating workshops, webinars, and educational content.
  
Community Building
  
– Establish and grow a strong data and AI community within the company, fostering collaboration, knowledge-sharing, and a culture of learning.
  
– Build and maintain relationships with subject matter experts to develop content for demos, case studies, and training events.
  
– Plan and execute community-driven activities such as hackathons, meetups, webinars, and interactive workshops to engage and inspire the broader organization.
  
Advocacy and Awareness
  
– Champion data literacy throughout the organization, advocating for its importance and integrating it into the company’s overall strategic objectives.
  
– Develop a variety of content, both written and visual, including newsletters, internal communication platforms, presentations, videos, and infographics, to promote engagement within the community.
  
Performance Metrics
  
– Define and track KPIs to measure the impact of community engagement and the success of training initiatives.
  
– Regularly report progress to senior leadership, providing insights and recommendations for further improvement based on data-driven analysis.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

– A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
  
– 5+ years of experience in data-related roles, community management, or program management within the tech or data space.
  
– Excellent communication skills, with the ability to craft clear and engaging content tailored to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  
– Strong organizational and project management skills with a keen attention to detail.
  
– Proven experience in planning, organizing, and executing successful community events (both virtual and in-person).
  
– A solid understanding of emerging technology trends, particularly in AI and data analytics.
  
– Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze and interpret metrics to measure engagement and effectiveness.
  
  

**Bonus Qualifications:**  

– Experience specifically building and leading data and AI communities.
  
– Background in data analytics, AI, or similar disciplines, with practical knowledge of tools such as Python, R, SQL, or Google Cloud Platform.
  
If you are someone who thrives in dynamic environments, loves working cross-functionally, and has a genuine interest in building data and AI literacy within an organization, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Agil Projektledare för SAP-migrering till Cloud
description:
Dina arbetsuppgifter
  
  

Är du en erfaren projektledare med fokus på agila metoder och djupgående kunskap om SAP- och molnmigrering? Vi söker nu en engagerad och målinriktad projektledare för att leda migreringen av ett affärskritiskt SAP-system från on-premise till Azure Cloud. Här får du möjlighet att ta en ledande roll i ett omfattande IT-infrastrukturprojekt med målet att modernisera och effektivisera plattformen för framtidens behov.
  
  

Om Rollen
  
  

Som agil projektledare kommer du att planera och exekvera migreringsarbetet för SAP-systemet. Du ansvarar för att leda tvärfunktionella team och samarbeta med både interna resurser och externa leverantörer för att säkerställa en framgångsrik övergång till en molnbaserad miljö. Rollen omfattar strategiskt och operativt ledarskap samt stakeholderhantering, och du kommer att arbeta i en skalad agil modell (SAFe).
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
  

* Planering och Ledarskap: Utveckla mål, tidslinjer, milstolpar och leverabler för projektet. Leda och stötta team i en kultur av förtroende och transparens där hinder kan identifieras och åtgärdas snabbt.
* Migrering av SAP till Azure Cloud: Säkerställa en framgångsrik migrering av SAP-systemet genom nära samarbete med team och leverantörer för att bygga en hållbar molnmiljö.
* Upphandling och Leverantörsstöd: Bidra till upphandling av samarbetspartners för migrering och framtida drift samt utveckla KPI: er och mål för upphandlingen.
* Införande av Tjänster och Processer: Leda arbetet med införande av nya tjänster och processer för IT-drift och säkerställa en effektiv övergång till den nya operativa modellen.
* Stakeholderhantering: Kommunicera framsteg, risker och utmaningar med interna och externa intressenter för att säkerställa initiativets mål.


Vem vi söker
  
  

Vi söker dig som är en erfaren och drivande projektledare med följande kvalifikationer:
  
  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att migrera stora affärskritiska system till Azure eller annan molnplattform.
* Erfarenhet av agil projektledning och ledarskap i IT-miljöer, särskilt inom infrastruktur, drift och molnlösningar.
* Gedigen förståelse för IT-drift och tillhörande processer i molnmiljöer samt erfarenhet av att leda agila team, gärna inom skalade agila modeller som SAFe.
* Erfarenhet av upphandling och leverantörshantering.
* Meriterande: erfarenhet av SAP-system och av rollen som scrum master.


Språkkrav
  
  

* Flytande svenska och engelska.


Omfattning och Plats
  
  

* Heltid
* Stockholm, med möjlighet till visst distansarbete


Start och Varaktighet
  
  

* Startdatum: 2024-12-02 eller 2025-01-01
* Slutdatum: 2026-03-31


Om oss
  
Sway Sourcing är ett modernt företag som rekryterar inom flera branscher på den svenska arbetsmarknaden. Vi matchar kandidaters kompetens och kunskap med företagets behov. Sway Sourcing har en företagsledning och personal med lång erfarenhet i rekryteringsbranschen, både som ägare och anställda. Vi har ett stort nätverk inom de branscher vi specialiserat oss inom och kan därför hitta de kandidater som snabbt blir en tillgång för företagen.

title: Cyber Security Analyst
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



We are the Software Digital organization within Engineering at Volvo, encompassing Car Software Development, the Car Cloud Platform, and Software Download & Installation. Our mission is to elevate the experience of owning a Volvo by making all cars connected and continuously enhancing the user experience across both new and existing vehicles.

  

  

As part of the Agile Release Train (ART) for the Car Cloud, we enable global cloud services that drive this connected experience. Our team develops, maintains, and operates a secure run-time ecosystem, supporting the growth of connected functionalities through standardized cloud technologies designed for high synergy and reusability. Our car cloud solution provides a robust infrastructure and essential services that facilitate the software development lifecycle through DevSecOps tools, ensuring quality and efficiency.  



**What you'll do**
------------------



In the role of Cybersecurity Expert, you will be pivotal in implementing new cloud functionalities in collaboration with agile development teams, product managers, and architects. Your expertise in cloud security will guide and mentor colleagues, helping align the organization's security and privacy goals. You will make critical, risk-based security decisions across systems, modules, and interfaces, working closely with car development teams and security specialists.

  


In this position, you’ll apply your knowledge of AWS, Kubernetes, and best practices in cloud software development security, while conducting IT security reviews and risk assessments of connected car solutions and contributing to the overarching security strategy for Volvo’s connected vehicles.


**What you'll bring**
---------------------



In order for you to fully enjoy this job we think that you have ideas on how the team can deliver secure functionality implemented on up to date IT cloud architecture and software.

  

We are looking for 2 possible backgrounds to complement the team:  

  

Someone with over eight years of experience, including comprehensive requirements-handling and knowledge of cloud-specific regulations

  


Or

  


Someone over five years of experience, specifically in tooling and AWS technologies, with relevant certifications, and experience in java development.

  

Common:

  

  

All candidates should hold a BSc degree or higher in engineering or an equivalent field, be proficient in English, and have strong communication and collaboration skills. Familiarity with AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, and security frameworks like OWASP SAMM is also highly beneficial. An analytical mindset, problem-solving abilities, and a commitment to achieving robust cybersecurity standards will ensure your success in this role.


**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Oskar Nätt at oskar.natt@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Maxime Nicco at maxime.nicco@volvocars.com.

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Agil Projektledare
description:
**Rollen:**  

Planering och Ledarskap  

* Kommunicerar mål i form av VAD och VARFÖR
* Utveckla och kommunicera planer som specificerar tidslinjer, milstolpar och leverabler. Du utvecklar planer tillsammans med de som exekverar arbetet.
* Leda tvärfunktionella team för att garantera framgångsrik leverans och nå mål.
* Skapar en kultur baserat på förtroende och öppenhet där hinder lyfts och det är lätt att be om hjälp
* Leda och arbeta inom en skalad agil modell baserad på SAFe
* Säkerställa att agila principer och praxis följs.

  

Framgångsrik flytt av SAP till cloud  

* Säkerställa att SAP migreras till Cloud med uppfyllda mål
* Säkerställa ett fungerande samarbete mellan team och leverantörer
* Säkra att samarbete kring uppsättning av målmiljö och förmågor för migrering fungerar

  

Upphandling av samarbetspartner för migrering och framtida drift  

* Stötta i upphandling av partner för migreringsprojekt och framtida drift
* Medverka i att utveckla KPI:er för upphandligen

  

Införande av Tjänster och Processer  

* Leda införande av tjänster för plattformar, ny operativmodell samt utvecklade processer för IT-drift.
* Säkerställa övergången till ny operativa modell med interna team och externa partners

  

Stakeholderhantering  

* Kommunicera effektivt initiativets framsteg, hinder, risker och utmaningar till intressenter och organisationen i stort.
* Samarbeta med interna och externa stakeholders för att säkerställa initiativet mål och framdrift.

  

**Ska-krav:**  

* Erfarenhet av att migrera stora affärskritiska system till Azure eller andra molnplattformar är ett krav.
* Erfarenhet av upphandling och leverantörshantering.
* Mycket goda färdigheter i kommunikation och dokumentation.
* Lång erfarenhet av projektledning av IT i agila organisationer, särskilt med fokus på infrastruktur, drift och molnlösningar.
* Kunskap om IT-drift i molnmiljöer med tillhörande processer.
* Erfarenhet av att leda agila iteam, särskilt inom en skalad agil modell.
* Lång erfarenhet av ledarskap och förändringsledning inom IT.
* Erfarenhet från rollen som scrum master är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av SAP är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en skalad agil modell (t.ex. SAFe, LeSS) från flera företag.
* Flytande i både svenska och engelska för effektiv kommunikation med olika intressenter.

  

**Var god förklara hur du uppfyller alla kraven.**  

  

**Omfattning:** 100%  

**Ort:** Stockholm  

**Period**: 01-12-2024-31-03-2026  

**Sista ansökningdag: 01-12-2024**  

*Vi presenterar löpande. Om du är intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.*

title: SAP Transformation Senior Manager/Director - Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group
description:
**SAP Transformation Senior Manager/Director - Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group**


Are you passionate about transforming businesses with the latest SAP technologies? Do you want to combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy expertise? If so, our roles as SAP Technology Consultant in our SAP Business Group are perfect for you!


Join Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

**About our Nordic SAP Business Group**


Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship of over 40 years. As the premier Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.


Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP, and SAP RISE. We are expanding our community and looking for candidates for several positions and seniority levels.

**SAP Transformation Senior Manager/Director**

As a Senior SAP Transformation Manager/Director, you will guide large-scale SAP transformation and conversion projects for our clients, combining hands-on technology expertise with strategic vision. You will manage multidisciplinary teams, oversee end-to-end project delivery, and drive technological innovations to solve complex business challenges. Beyond delivery, you will contribute to business development, collaborate with sales teams to identify new opportunities, and shape solutions that align with our clients’ strategic goals.

**Key Responsibilities**

**SAP Transformation Management**

* Drive and support complex SAP transformation projects from planning through execution, ensuring they meet scope, budget, and timeline requirements.
* Deliver high-quality SAP S/4HANA, ECC, BTP, and other SAP product implementations, upgrades, and integrations.
* Act as a trusted advisor to clients, understanding their unique business needs and tailoring solutions to deliver maximum value.

**Team and Stakeholder Management**

* Coach and develop a team of SAP consultants and technology specialists, fostering a high-performance culture.
* Manage cross-functional teams, including functional consultants, developers, and project managers, to achieve cohesive project execution.
* Facilitate effective communication between business stakeholders and the project team, ensuring alignment and clarity.

**Business Development and Sales Support**

* Collaborate with sales and account teams to develop new business opportunities and support client proposals and pitches.
* Identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities within ongoing projects, positioning our SAP offerings for maximum impact.

**Technology Strategy and Innovation**

* Stay current with the latest SAP technologies, tools, and industry trends, guiding clients and teams on best practices and innovative solutions.
* Define technology roadmaps for clients, aligning SAP architecture and landscape with long-term business goals.
* Identify opportunities to optimize clients’ SAP environments for improved scalability, resilience, and efficiency.

**Risk Management and Quality Assurance**

* Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful project outcomes.
* Conduct regular project reviews to track progress, manage risks, and adjust project plans as necessary.

  

**Preferred Qualifications and Experience**

* **Experience**: 10+ years of SAP project experience, including 5+ years in management roles managing complex transformations.
* **Leadership**: Proven track record of managing multidisciplinary teams, coaching talent, and delivering successful SAP projects.
* **Technical Skills**: Deep expertise in SAP S/4HANA, BTP, SAP ECC, Fiori, SAP Cloud, and related technologies.
* **Business Acumen**: Strong business development skills, including presales, proposal preparation, and client engagement.
* **Certifications**: Relevant SAP certifications (e.g., SAP S/4HANA, Solution Architect) are a plus.

**What’s in it for you**

* Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.
* Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.
* Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.
* Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.
* Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, top industry add-on software, expert network, and benchmarks.
* A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.
* Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.
* Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP technology by investigating, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.
* Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network for collaboration and delivery.
* Appealing compensation and benefits.
* Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.
* Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP technology Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, professional development, and sales initiatives.


Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity.


#LI-EU
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Associate Consultant
description:
General information
Country
Sweden


City
Kista


Job ID
42256


Department
Infor Consulting Services


Experience Level
ENTRY\_LEVEL


Employment Status
FULL\_TIME


Workplace Type
Hybrid


Description & Requirements
As a **Consultant Associate**, you'll dive into a dynamic role where every day brings new challenges and opportunities. You’ll be at the forefront of **implementing cutting-edge ERP solutions**, helping businesses streamline their operations. Your day-to-day will involve **analyzing business processes**, **collaborating with clients**, and **designing innovative solutions** that make an impact.


This role is perfect for someone who loves problem-solving, working with people, learning, and making a difference in the digital transformation.

  

The daily task of the Consultant Associate consists of:

* Implement ERP solutions
* Analyzing business processes
* Customer interaction
* Designing business solutions
* Participating in and preparing workshops
* Learning new methods of business implementation
* Supporting customer training
* Assisting in go-lives

  

You're a fit for the role if you identify with one or more of the below characteristics:

* A genuine interest in business processes and IT
* Fluent in English and Swedish
* Willingness to travel and a driving license
* Eager to grow and learn
* Enjoy interacting with other people
* Education or knowledge about Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Manufacturing, Finance, or Information Systems

  

What do we offer?

* Start September 2025
* Full-time permanent contract from day one
* International Onboarding Week in Poland
* A mentor who will help you to navigate the new tasks
* Hands-on experience in customer projects
* Ongoing learning, and career development opportunities
* Work with experienced seniors and with other Early Talents
* Competitive salary from the beginning of your career
* Hybrid type of work
* Office in Stockholm, Malmö and Linköping
* Office activities, wellness benefits, holiday

  

About The Early Talent Program

  

Project work • Product training • Mentor work • Soft skills training • Customer consulting • Traveling


The program duration is 12 months and consists of both training in our academy and working on projects to provide you with broad hands-on experience to accelerate your career in consulting. Early on in this program, you will help customers to benefit from our world-class Cloud solutions for companies within the Distribution, Food & Beverage, and Manufacturing industries. This will give you a solid foundation in running innovative local and global Infor projects from both an IT and a business perspective in several key business areas.


It's set in an international environment where you will interact with instructors and other Early Talents from EMEA. In addition to training in business processes, applications, and Industry solutions, you will also get an introduction to Infor, our values, and how we operate. All are designed to enable you to learn to innovate, improve, and transform yourself into a skilled consultant.

  


  

About Infor  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
For more information visit www.infor.com  


Our Values  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.
company_description: Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems.

title: Head of CloudHW & Transport Ops (Make)
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are looking for the Head of Cloud HW & Transport Ops (Make), a key senior role within Supply Chain Management leadership Team, reporting to the Head of Cloud HW & Transport Supply.

  

  

In the 3 months horizon you will be driving the operative activities, ensuring availability of Cloud HW & Transport products in line with forecasted level and segmented lead-time offers. You will collaborate with key senior internal stakeholders including members of the Supply Leadership Team, Sourcing, Product Line and R&D. In addition, you will provide strong leadership and expertise around operational activities and EMS Management.

  

This is an outstanding opportunity to join a leading BU Operations organization, delivering value through your strong results focus, a growth mindset and a change leader.

  

The position can be based in one of our 4 locations: Borås, Kista (Sweden), Nanjing (China) or Tallin (Estonia).

 **What you will do:**

* Drive the supply process to secure Cloud HW & Transport product availability to our Customers according to roll-out plans and Customers needs.
* Optimize the production plans of our external EMS to ensure efficient dimensioning of the Supply Chain capability.
* Understand customer needs and pro-actively act to Supply capability and lead inventory across the supply chain.
* Be responsible for the development and implementation of overall supply strategy, processes, and goals for Cloud HW & Transport Supply Operation (make products).
* Lead and develop a team to secure future competence needs, encouraging employee skill development and professional growth.
* Secure alignment with Ericsson Way of Working in daily business.

 **The skills you bring:**

* A MSc in Engineering or BSc with 5+ years’ experience within Telecommunication business
* A customer oriented mindset
* Extensive experience in Supply chain operations (10+ years)
* Strong analytical skills to take a data driven approach to analyze, influence, strategize and educate
* Demonstrated leadership capability
* Competence to influence across organizations, optimally leading change, originating ideas, gaining dedication
* Experience with Telecom electronics vendors, distributors and third party vendors
* Significant EMS management experience
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Borås

**Req ID:** 756387

title: Early Career Program Commercial Strategy
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Our Excellerate Global Leadership Program will give you an outstanding opportunity to engage with commercial projects at a strategic and global level, rising up to challenges and becoming and developing as a leader.  

As part of the Excellerate program you are able to seize the initiative, operate with a consultative approach and collaborate on cross-technology solutions. The program will ensure you gain real practical insight into our business, our stakeholders and our customers including communication service providers (CSP) across the globe, and how we integrate end-to-end solutions to ensure everyone worldwide is connected.


Your journey within the Excellerate Program will start as a Commercial Strategy at Business Area Networks Sales & Commercial Management!

 **What you will do:**

  

Cloud Commercial Strategy Team Objective and tasks:

* Drive the development of Open RAN and 5G Advanced commercial strategies for Software, Services and pre-integrated Solutions and align those strategies with HW related aspects owned by the Strategic Commercial Mgmt. team
* Influence future Open RAN, 5G Advanced and 6G strategy in discussions with Product Lines, Technology & Strategy and Engineering Units, positioning key commercial requirements and embed those in a continuously evolving NextGen commercial strategy
* Lead the commercial push for Ericsson to become a professional SW company through the NextGen SW business flow transformation program through developing innovative SW commercial models and anchor those as well as operational and product requirements across the organization
* Develop and evolve commercial strategies for new Software products in areas like: rApps and Intelligent RAN Automation
* New technologies demand new services and system-integration approach. Develop an Advanced Engineering Services commercial strategy and influence the company discussion on ORAN and SI services with commercial insights
 **The skills you bring:**

  

Joining the team will offer you an exciting journey through business and technology where you will learn, be able to challenge, take decisions and most importantly have a lot of fun! We believe you can challenge us in who we're looking for and believe you have an interest for business/commercial management combined with a technical interest in the communications industry.

**In addition, we believe you have:**

  

* Gathering information on latest analyst and market reports with the BI team
* Draw and summarize insights from those reports and develop proposals for new or enhancing existing product commercial strategies
* Discuss and present those insights and strategies within the BNEW Cloud Commercial Strategy team and to the Head of Commercial Strategy & Analytics
* Follow up on success of execution of commercial strategies and strategic pricing, including analysis of Market Areas feedback, customer feedback and competitor intelligence
* Highly developed analytical skills, together with structured problem-solving and aspiration for providing thought leadership
* Very good business acumen and understanding of financial data
* Ideally first knowledge of the Networks portfolio, with ability to articulate the value of a full solution which combines HW, SW, Services and ability to understand customer struggles
* A global attitude and willingness to relocate internationally, with a desire and ability to work in a multicultural environment
* Keen interest to learn new things and to broaden experience
* Ability to collaborate, engage with and mobilize the organization to secure results
* Solid presentation and communication skills, and proficiency in English

  

We can promise you a steep learning curve, exciting tasks and close collaboration as a valued member of a strategically important team. Be the one who did. Find out more about our Early Career program, what the alumni's are up to now and how the program can transform your career at www.ericsson.com/ecp

  

The selection and interview process is ongoing, so send your application in English. If you have specific questions you are welcome to email recruiter Srishti Tandon srishti.tandon@ericsson.com

 **Why join Ericsson?**

  

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

title: Early Career Program Financial Controller
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Our Excellerate Global Leadership Program will give you an outstanding opportunity to engage with commercial projects at a strategic and global level, rising up to challenges and becoming and developing as a leader.


As part of the Excellerate program you are able to seize the initiative, operate with a consultative approach and collaborate on cross-technology solutions. The program will ensure you gain real practical insight into our business, our stakeholders and our customers including communication service providers (CSP) across the globe, and how we integrate end-to-end solutions to ensure everyone worldwide is connected.


Your journey within the Excellerate Program will start as a Financial Controller in BA Cloud Software and Services (BCSS). BCSS provides industry leading solutions for Core Network and Automation, Managed Services, Services Orchestration, BSS, and Cognitive AI Software. We help enable communications service providers to succeed with their cloud native software and automated operations, as they prepare their networks for the future.

 **What you will do:**

  

You will be joining the central finance team in BCSS where you’ll contribute to a wide range of essential finance activities. You will spend your time with day-to-day responsibilities as well as cross unit strategic tasks and help analyse complex financial and non-financial data, create visually compelling reports, and turn numbers into actionable insights. You will be part of a diverse team of experienced colleagues.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

Joining the team will offer you an exciting journey through business and technology where you will learn, be able to challenge, take decisions and most importantly have a lot of fun! We believe that you have a curious and positive mindset and a challenging attitude. A genuine interest for business and financial management is very important together with a technical interest in the communications industry.

  

In addition, we believe you have:

* BSc or MSc in Business Finance or similar
* 2-4 years of relevant work experience in e.g. strategy, accounting, business control
* Passion about bringing your ideas to the table
* A global attitude and willingness to relocate internationally, with a desire and ability to work in a multicultural environment
* Keen interest to learn new things and to broaden experience
* Ability to collaborate, engage with and mobilize the organization to secure results
* Solid presentation and communication skills, and proficiency in English

  

We can promise you a steep learning curve, exciting tasks and close collaboration as a valued member of a strategically important team. Be the one who did. title: Early Career Program Strategic Solutions Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Our Innovate Graduate Technology Program will give you an outstanding opportunity to understand and take part in shaping our technology leadership and is the perfect fit for you who have a diligent, innovative, and creative approach.  

As part of the Innovate programs you will be curious about how the next generation of technology will shape and influence the way we all live and work. The program will give you a chance to work with like-minded people who are pioneers in our business and advanced problem solvers in their chosen field. You’ll collaborate with them to solve some of the most challenging issues faced by our customers to ensure everyone worldwide is connected.


Your journey within the Innovate Program will start as Strategic Solutions Manager at Product Line Radio within Business Area Networks.

 **What you will do:**

  

In product line 5G RAN you will get a unique connection between engineering units, market areas, and customers. You will be able to follow a product through the complete life-cycle: from an idea in R&D, discussing it with customers, developing the product, and finally delivering it to commercial networks. We offer opportunity to influence across the company and through that build an understanding of where you want to grow and contribute further in your career

* The team is responsible for shaping the formulation of business strategy and execution for product line 5G RAN, as well as securing RAN performance leadership of our products. We do this by bringing the outside in perspective, including operator, market and competitor intelligence. We stay close to the leading operators to understand how they will drive Ericsson technology roadmap.
* We are a new team, that is growing in both influence and strength. Being part of product line Cloud & Purpose-built 5G RAN, we work closely with strategic product managers across Product Area Networks.
* As a team we’re all focused on ensuring that Ericsson has the best 5G RAN offering on the market for both purpose built and Cloud-RAN. And we are key stakeholders to secure continued market leadership and business success.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

Joining the team will offer you a fun and challenging environment where you can grow and inspire your colleagues to further growth. We believe you can challenge us in who we're looking for and have a motivation and interest in working in a research area within our industry, ideally with some relevant experience in mathematics and Technology.


In addition, we believe you have:

* Must-have: Master of Science in e.g. telecommunications, computer science or engineering physics. interest and ability to quickly understand new technology concepts. Business mind set. ability to build strong personal relationships.
* Work closely with Strategic Product Managers, as well as other stakeholders in Business area networks, to evaluate Ericsson position and opportunities with new and existing technologies. Requires studies of technologies, how it will impact our customers, and Ericsson’s ability to monetize it.
* Interest in experimentation and innovation with the ability to think creatively and be well adapted to change
* Knowledge of wireless communication, radio networks and AI & Machine Learning
* Experience of SW engineering or development with hands-on programming
* A global attitude and willingness to relocate internationally, with a desire and ability to work in a multicultural environment
* Keen interest to learn new things and to broaden experience
* Ability to collaborate, engage with and mobilize the organization to secure results
* Solid presentation and communication skills, and proficiency in English

  

  

Be the one who did. Find out more about our Early Career program, what the alumni's are up to now and how the program can transform your career at www.ericsson.com/ecp  

The selection and interview process is ongoing, so send your application in English. If you have specific questions you are welcome to email recruiter Srishti Tandon srishti.tandon@ericsson.com

title: Product Manager Atlassian
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 The Atlassian Product Manager role is part of Sinch's global Enterprise IT organization, managing our internal IT services. In this role it is important to be self-going, forward looking, great collaborator and with a can-do attitude to be successful together with us.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Key tasks and responsibilities as the Product Manager of Atlassian is to take an E2E custodian responsibility of the platform globally. This entails developing the Product strategy and technology roadmap based on business needs, market technology developments and best practices. Furthermore, the Product Manager is expected to:
   

  

* Take lead of the Cloud migration project currently being executed including merging of local Atlassian instances of Jira and Confluence.
* Act as a subject matter expert to educate other parts of the organization regarding best practices within the Atlassian product portfolio.
* Drive solution design, architecture, and implementation across Jira SW, Jira SM, and Confluence in alignment with business stakeholder requirements.
* Safeguard quality of the Atlassian product portfolio to ensure changes are introduced and managed properly.
* Budget and license management to ensure efficiency in the delivery of the Atlassian related products and services.
* Engage with external partners to participate in contract renewals, project work and service delivery.


 In this role you will have the opportunity to influence and make an impact on the area moving forward. Atlassian is used across the company e.g. in our Engineering teams and internal support functions, hence it is a high visibility role from and IT perspective. You will work together with different teams across the business and a collaborative and listening mindset is important to succeed.
   

  

**Requirements**
* A university degree combined with at least 10 years of relevant technical experience in Atlassian preferably both in Cloud and DC.
* Professional & concise communication skills.
* Leadership skills, capability to drive and motivate both self and others.
* Ability to drive change in global organizations.
* Planning and prioritization of time and resources.


 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in English.
   

  

**OUR HIRING PROCESS**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  

 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Required:**
* 5+ years of relevant experience
* Deep knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure
* Minimum 4 years experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers


**Nice to Have:**
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**
 A chance to participate in the development of a leading global software firm. You have the opportunity to work within an organization, that gives you the freedom and autonomy to be successful. An attractive salary while working in a challenging international environment with enthusiastic colleagues who like to learn from each other.
   

  

 At Unit4 we invest in your personal and professional growth. We don't focus on how many days you work, we trust you on delivering results - thus, we have an unlimited vacation policy.
   

  

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: IT Infrastructure Specialist
description:
We now have a new need and are therefore looking for a consulting colleague with the qualifications below. The position is part of our consulting services, which means you will be employed by us and work with clients or internal projects and assignments.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The team is responsible for Terraform as part of the DevOps platform. The assignment is to build and support automation solutions around the platform.
   

  

**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
 Strong knowledge of:
   

  

* Git, including branching models, tagging, PRs and code reviews, tasks
* Understanding of importance and experience with linting
* API knowledge – verbs, request & response payloads, authentication methods, path/query/body parameters, headers
* Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and deployment patterns; build & deploy phases
* Understanding of importance of the proper documentation and examples + Markdown format
* Bash scripting proficiency
* Good troubleshooting skills
* Able to work independently


**Good to have knowledge of any combinations of:**
 Ansible
   

  

* Collections, roles, modules
* Plays and playbooks
* Good Jinja2 templating knowledge
* Secrets handling
* Loops, interacting with web services
* Ideally AWX / AAP experience


 Jenkins
   

  

* Triggering jobs externally
* Developing pipelines, steps, stages, basic DSL knowledge
* Error handling
* Developing libraries
* Parameters and parameter types
* Groovy experience
* Tekton knowledge


 Terraform
   

  

* Data sources and resources
* Understanding of providers, modules, experience in module development
* Running tf code conditionally + loops
* Templating, complex structure / variables handling
* Forcing dependencies, targeting resources
* Knowledge about tf state, importing resources
* Ideally TFE experience
* Code security


 Containers and Kubernetes
   

  

* Good understanding of: container, pod, deployment, service, ingress, secret, replica set, namespace
* Hands-on experience with kubectl + kubeconfig
* Managing volumes
* Scaling deployments
* Troubleshooting, analysing logs and events
* Good understanding of Dockerfile and building images, image tagging
* Container registry


 Python
   

  

* At least mid level


**Application deadline:** 
 13-11-2024
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*
